たいして【大して】
(1)（下に打ち消しの語を伴って）特別。 それほど。 さほど。
「～よくない」「～困らない」
(2)程度がはなはだしいさま。
「様子は好し， 其上世辞がありまするので， ～客がござります/真景累ヶ淵（円朝）」

たいして【大して】
〔否定文で用いて〕 very; much; especially; particularly.
●それは大して危険ではない. It is not very [especially, particularly] dangerous.
・雑誌を見て行ってみたが, 大してうまい店じゃなかったね. I saw the place in a magazine and went, but the food wasn't all that good, after all.
・みんなは面白いと言っているが僕には大して面白くなかった. Everybody says it's fun [interesting, exciting], but I didn't find it much fun [especially interesting, particularly exciting].
・ここは寒さは厳しいが, 雪は大して降らない. It gets bitterly cold here, but it doesn't snow much.
・家のペンキを塗り直してみたが大して変わりばえしない. I tried repainting the house, but there's not much of an improvement in appearance.
・大して勉強もしないくせに成績は常にトップだった. Her grades were always the highest in the class, even though she didn't do much study.
・大しておかまいもできませんが. I'm afraid I can't offer you much in the way of hospitality.

「 たいして 」
☆ adv
☆ không...nhiều; không...lắm
☆ 雪は大してふられなかった: tuyết không rơi nhiều lắm.
☆ Ghi chú: dùng trong câu phủ định để mang nghĩa là không...nhiều / không ...lắm
.

I な【名】
(1)人が認識した事物に， 他の事物と区別するために言葉で言い表した呼称。 名前。 （ア）同じ性質を有する一定範囲の事物をひとまとめにした呼称。
「東から吹く風の～を東風(コチ)という」「いかづちは～のみにもあらず， いみじうおそろし/枕草子 153」（イ）一定範囲の事物に属する個々の物に付けた呼称。 「国の～」「～も知れぬ遠き島」
(2)人の呼び名。 （ア）人ひとりひとりに付けた呼び名。 姓に対して名前。
「生まれた子に～を付ける」「娘の～は花子です」（イ）姓名。 氏名。 「私の～は田中花子です」「～を名乗れ」「～をばさかきの造(ミヤツコ)となむいひける/竹取」
(3)その呼び名とともに世にあらわれた評判。 （ア）よい評判。 名声。
「世に～が高い」「～のある人」（イ）名誉。 「～が傷つく」（ウ）あまりかんばしくない評判。 うわさ。 「～が立つ」
(4)実質を伴わない名称。 （ア）名目。 体裁。
「ホテルとは～ばかりの安宿」（イ）表向きの理由。 口実。 「開発の～のもとに自然を破壊する」
(5)名義。
「会社の～で申し込む」
(6)古く国語の単語分類に用いた語で， 現在の名詞に相当するもの。 室町時代の連歌論書にすでに見え， 江戸時代の国学者富士谷成章もこれを用いた。
→ 装
→ 挿頭
→ 脚結
～有・り
有名である。 名高い。
「僧綱たち， ～・る持者(ジサ)どもなど召して/宇津保（国譲下）」
～有りて実(ジツ)なし
〔漢書（循吏伝）〕
評判ばかりで実質が伴わない。 有名無実。 名あって実無し。
～が売・れる
世間に名が知られるようになる。 有名になる。
～が立・つ
評判になる。 また， 浮き名が立つ。
～が通・る
世間によく知られている。 評判になる。
～が泣・く
その名に値しない。
「国会議員の～・く」
～に負(オ)・う
(1)名高い。 評判である。
「これやこの～・ふ鳴門(ナルト)の渦潮に/万葉 3638」
(2)名としてもっている。
「大伴の氏(ウジ)と～・へるますらをの伴(トモ)/万葉 4465」
～に聞・く
うわさとして聞く。 また， 評判である。 有名である。
「まことや～・きし寂光の都， 喜見城の楽しみもかくやと思ふばかりの景色かな/謡曲・邯鄲」
～にし負(オ)・う
〔「し」は強意の助詞〕
「名に負う」を強めた言い方。
「～・はばいざこと問はむ都鳥/伊勢 9」
～にそむ・く
その名声に反する。 評判と異なる。
「老舗(シニセ)の～・かない味」
～に立・つ
世に聞こえる。 評判になる。
「～・てる吉田の里の杖(ツエ)なればつくとも尽きじ君が万代(ヨロズヨ)/拾遺（神楽）」
～に恥(ハ)じない
名前や評価を傷つけることがない。
「名人の～ない戦いぶり」
～に旧(フ)・る
古くから有名である。 古くからその名が広まっている。
「ここぞ～・る鈴の森/浄瑠璃・八百屋お七」
～は実(ジツ)の賓(ヒン)
〔「荘子（逍遥遊）」より。 賓は主に対する客， そえものの意。 尭から天子の位を譲られるのを， 許由が辞退したときの言葉〕
名誉は実際の徳のそえものである。 実質のない名誉は無意味なものである。
～は体(タイ)を表す
名はそのものの実体を言い表している。 名と実体は相応じる。
～も無・い
名前が知られていない。 無名の。
「～・い花」
～をあ・げる
世に名声をあらわす。 有名になる。
～を売・る
名が広く知れわたるようにする。
「勝負師として～・った男」
～を得る
名声を得る。 名高くなる。
～を惜(オ)し・む
名声が傷つくのを惜しむ。
～を借・りる
(1)他人の名義をかりる。
(2)口実とする。
「アンケートに～・りた思想調査」
～を汚(ケガ)・す
名誉を傷つけ評判を落とす。 名を辱(ハズカシ)める。
「母校の～・す行為」
～を雪(スス)（(ソソ)）・ぐ
汚名や悪評を功績をあげることによって消す。 名誉を回復する。
「卑怯者の～・ぐ」
～を捨てて実(ジツ)を取る
世間的な名声を得るよりも， 実質的な利のある方を選ぶ。
～を正(タダ)・す
〔論語（子路）〕
(1)名分を正す。
→ 正名
(2)正邪を判断する。
～を立・つ
(1)〔史記（伯夷伝）〕
名声をあげる。 名をあげる。
「ますらをは名をし立つべし/万葉 4165」
(2)評判をたてる。 浮き名が立つ。
「あるまじき～・ち/源氏（夕霧）」
～を竹帛(チクハク)に垂(タ)る
〔「後漢書（鄧禹伝）」による。 「竹帛」は書物の意〕
名を後世に伝え残す。 歴史書に記録されるような功績を立てる。
～を連・ねる
名前を並べて公にする。
「発起人に～・ねる」
～を遂(ト)・げる
名声を得る。
「功成り～・げる」
～を留(トド)・める
名声を後世に残す。
「歴史上に～・める」
～を取・る
評判をとる。 名声を得る。 名を得る。
「ありありて， をこがましき～・るべきかな/源氏（夕顔）」
～を取るより徳(トク)を取れ
実益の伴わない名声を得るよりも実利を得た方がよい。
～を流(ナガ)・す
名を世に広める。 評判をたてられる。
「末の世に聞き伝へてかろびたる名をや流さむ/源氏（帚木）」
～を成(ナ)さしめる
競う相手に負けて， 高名を得させる。
「宿敵に～しめる」
～を成(ナ)・す
その道ですぐれた人物として有名になる。
「作家として～・す」
～を盗・む
実力がないのに評判になる。
～を残・す
名声を後世に伝える。
～を辱(ハズカシ)・める
名声を傷つける。
～を馳(ハ)・せる
広く知られる。

II みょう【名】
「名田」の略。

III めい【名】
※一※ （名）
(1)なまえ。 な。
「姓と～」
(2)名詞の上に付いて， すぐれている， 評判が高い， などの意を表す。
「～文句」「～議長」「～バイオリニスト」
※二※ （接尾）
助数詞。 人数を数えるのに用いる。
「人(ニン)」よりは丁寧な言い方。 「三～行方不明」「何～いるか」

Iな【名】
1 〔氏名〕 a name; 〔名字に対する〕 a personal [Christian, given] name; 《米》 a first name; 〔名称〕 a name; a designation; a denomination; an appellation; a title.
●花の名 the name of a flower; a flower's name; a flower name
・県の名 the name of a prefecture; a prefecture's name
・会社の名 the name of a company; a company's name; a company name
・家の名 〔姓〕 a family name; a surname; 〔屋号〕 the name of a 《米》 store [《英》 shop]; a 《米》 store [《英》 shop] name.
●名も知れぬ小島 an obscure island; an island with an obscure name; an unknown island
・名も告げずに立ち去る leave without even giving one's name.
●名がない[ついてない] have no name; be nameless; be unnamed
・新聞に名が出る one's name appears in the newspaper(s); get one's name in the newspaper
・番組の最後に出演者の名が出た. At the end of the program appeared [were shown] the names of the actors and actresses.
・旧友の話をしているうちに僕の初恋の人の名が出た. While we were talking about our old friends, the name of my first love came up.
・ラベルの隅に小さく会社の名があった. The name of the company was given in small print in the corner of the label.
・そのポスターには錚々([sub]そうそう[/sub])たる名が連ねられていた. The great names were listed on the poster.
・彼の名が名簿の筆頭に来ている. His name heads [tops] the list. | His name comes first on [at the top of] the list.
●予約は私の名で取ってあります. The reservation is [was made] in my name. | We have a reservation in my name.
・…の名で通る go by the name of 《John》; be (generally) known as 《the Killer》
・本名は「三郎」だが, 友人の間では「サブ」の名で通っている. His real name is Saburō, but his friends call him “Sabu.”
・彼は「サキ」という名で作品を書いた. He wrote under the name of “Saki.”
●…の名にふさわしい[そむかない] be worthy of the [one's, its] name; be true to one's [its] name; live up to one's [its] name
・「富士見旅館」の名にふさわしく, 窓からは富士山がよく見える. True to its name, the “Fujimi,” the inn provides a good view of Mt. Fuji.
・名にそむく belie one's [its] name; be untrue to one's name
・ボリビアは, その土地をスペインから解放したシモン･ボリバルの名に因む. Bolivia takes its name [is named after] Simón Bolívar, who freed it from Spanish rule.
●…という名の人[店, 植物] a person [shop, plant] called [《文》 by the name of]…
・名のわかっていない人 an unidentified person; a person whose name one doesn't know
・私と同じ名の人 a person with the same name as me [mine]
・その名の示すように as the name indicates [shows, suggests]; as implied by the name; as you can tell [see] from the name
・その名のとおり as the [its] name implies[shows, indicates]
・ナマケモノはその名のとおりほとんど一日中木にぶらさがって眠っている. True to its name, a sloth sleeps hanging on a tree almost all day.
・そんな名の人は知らない. I do not know anyone with [of, by] that name.
・私は果物と名のつく物なら何でも好きだ. I like any and every [all kinds of] fruit. | I like anything that goes by the name of fruit.
・占いと名のつくものは一通り試してみた. I tried everything that had anything to do with divination.
・名の由来 the origin(s) of a name; why sb [sth] is called 《Rue》.
●名をつける give 《sb, sth》 a name; name; 〔洗礼名を〕 christen
・生まれた子供に名をつける give a newborn baby a name; name a baby
・拾った猫に「ミケ」という名をつけた. I gave an adopted kitten the name “Miké.”
・名を変える change one's name; take [get] a new name
・その店は「ハル」と名を変えてオープンした. The store reopened under a new name, (as) “Hal” [the new name of “Hal”].
・…の名を借りて borrowing [assuming] 《sb's》 name; under the name of…
・友人の名を借りて彼女に手紙を書いた. I wrote to her under the name of a friend of mine. | I sent her a letter and signed it with the name of a friend.
・名を出す mention [give, publish] one's name; identify oneself
・会社の名を出すのは控えるが, その人はそこの重役だ. He is a director of a certain company, which shall be nameless [go unnamed].
・名を伏せる withhold one's name; (choose to) be [remain] anonymous
・私の名を表に出したくない. I wish to remain anonymous [unknown].
・名を出さないで欲しいと言う ask [request] anonymity
・寄付はするが, 私の名を出さないでくれ. I'll make a contribution, but don't let my name appear [I don't want my name mentioned].
・名を言う[告げる] say [give, announce] one's name
・受付で私の名を言えばすぐに通してくれるはずだ. If you mention [tell them, give them] my name at reception, they'll let you straight in.
・彼女の名を言うとだれもが顔を見合わせた. At the mention of her name, everybody looked at one another.
・花の名を言う say the name of a flower; identify a flower (by its name)
・名を呼ぶ call sb's name; call sb (by name)
・名を呼ばれて返事する answer to one's name; answer when one [one's name] is called
・名を挙げる mention sb [sb's name, sb by name]
・名を明かす reveal [disclose] one's name
・名を秘す conceal sb's name; keep sb's name to oneself [secret]
・名を偽る use [go under, assume] a false identity; 《文》 misrepresent oneself 《as…》; 《文》 masquerade as…
・名を騙([sub]かた[/sub])る impersonate sb; use [go under, assume] sb's name; make fraudulent use of sb's name
・友人の名を騙って方々で借金を重ねた. She impersonated a friend and ran up debts all over the place.
・名を貸す lend one's name 《to sb》; allow one's name to be used
・…の名を継ぐ take [inherit, succeed to] the name of…
・…にちなんで名をつける call [name] sb [sth] after [《米》 for]…
・娘には私の祖母の名を取ってつけた. We called our daughter after my grandmother. | We gave our daughter my grandmother's name.
・名を名乗れ. State your name! | Your name!
・このクラブのメンバーには錚々([sub]そうそう[/sub])たる人物が名を連ねている. The club's list of members includes the names of a lot of powerful people. | There are a lot of influential people (listed) among the members.
・大学創設者の名を冠する奨学金 a scholarship bearing the name of the university's founder
・スポンサー企業の名を冠したテニス大会 a tennis tournament named 《米》 for [《英》 after] the sponsoring company.
●彼女の名は佐知子という. Her name's Sachiko. | She's called Sachiko.
・オーデコロンの名は「ケルン」という地名に由来する. Eau de cologne takes its name from a place name, “Köln.”
・その人は名だけは聞いて[知って]いる. I know him by name. | I know her name. | His name is familiar to me (but I've never met him).
・弱き者よ! 汝の名は女なり. Frailty! thy name is woman. <▲> Hamlet より.
・名は体を表す. People's names often show what they are like [fit people's personalities]. | | Nomen, omen.
・姓は丹下, 名は左膳. My surname is Tange and my given name is Sazen. | The name is Tange; Tange Sazen.
・彼女の名はこの町では知らない者がない. Everyone in this town knows her [her name]. | She's well-known around here. | There is nobody in town who doesn't know her name.
2 〔名声〕 (a) reputation; a name; fame; renown; distinction; eminence; celebrity; 〔信用〕 credit.
●名もない obscure; unknown (to fame)
・名もない人々 people of no fame [name]; obscure [insignificant] people; ordinary people (who are not particularly famous or important)
・名も知れぬ[ない]会社 a lesser-known company; a company that is not famous; a nameless company.
●うちの会社もようやくこの業界で名が知られるようになってきた. Our company is finally becoming well known [getting a name for itself].
・名が上がる one's name becomes famous [gets known]; get a name for oneself
・…で大いに名が売れる become widely known 《for one's juggling skills, as a result of one's performance》
・こんなまずい料理を出せば老舗旅館の名が泣く. Lousy food like this will let down [be a blot on] the reputation of this famous old ryokan.
・名が高い be famous [well known, distinguished, noted]; have a (great) reputation [famous name]
・彼女は名医の名が高い. She is well known as a distinguished doctor [a doctor of great repute]. | She's famous as a good doctor.
・これにより上海は「東洋のパリ」という名がついた. This earned Shanghai the title of “Paris of the East.” | Because of this, Shanghai became known as “the Paris of the East.”
●名にかかわる 〈事が主語〉 affect [damage, be bad for, have a bad effect on, 《文》 compromise] sb's reputation; reflect on the good name 《of…》; 〈人が主語〉 lose one's reputation 《for good service》
・こんな品を扱っては店の名にかかわる. Selling things like this in the shop will affect [be bad for] our reputation.
・名に負う ⇒なにしおう
・名に恥じない live up to one's [its] name; be worthy of one's reputation
・名工の名に恥じない出来ばえ an article worthy of the hand of a master; a worthy product of a great craftsman.
●名のある famous; well-known; noted; eminent; celebrated; major; renowned; reputed; 《口》 big-name; big-shot
・名のあるお方とお見受けしました. I understand that you are famous [well-known, an authority, 《口》 a big name] 《in this field》.
・あれはいずれ名のある人に違いない. I'm sure she's somebody famous [some big figure].
・名の知れた[聞こえた] known; well-known; famous; noted; popular; 《a person》 of repute [name]
・若いころは少しは名の知れた役者だったんだよ. When I was young I had a certain reputation as an [was a fairly well-known] actor.
・全国的に名の通った known nationwide [throughout the country, all over 《Japan》]; of national [nationwide] fame
・彼の家はこの辺では名の通った旧家だ. He comes from an old family that is well known in these parts.
●名を上げる[成す, 馳([sub]は[/sub])せる] become [get] famous; make oneself famous; make one's name; make [win] a name for oneself; acquire [make, build up, gain, win] a reputation 《as a scholar》; achieve [gain, win] fame; achieve [win, obtain] distinction; make one's name familiar [known] to the public; distinguish oneself; rise to fame [distinction]; achieve glory 《on the battlefield》
・彼はその作品で一躍名を上げた. He sprang to fame with this work. | The work gained him sudden fame.
・彼は次第に名を上げた. He gradually gained a reputation [became well known].
・京都画壇に名を成す become well known [build up a reputation] among Kyoto artists
・いずれ名を成す人 a person who will definitely achieve fame; a candidate for fame
・世界に名を成す become [make oneself] famous all over the world; gain a worldwide reputation 《as a scholar》
・その戦で彼は知将として名をはせた. The battle gave [got] him a reputation as a wily general.
・世上に名をうたわれた名優 a great actor of wide repute [whose name is on everybody's lips]; a great and widely known actor
・名を売る get oneself fame [a name, a reputation]; make oneself famous [well known, popular]; aim for fame [distinction, a reputation]; seek fame
・名を売るために for fame's sake; to get oneself known; in pursuit of fame; for the sake of fame [notoriety]
・名を残す[とどめる] leave a name behind (one); leave one's mark 《on the history of…》; be remembered; go down in history; live on in history [people's memory]
・歴史に名をとどめる人物 a person who leaves his mark on [goes down in] history
・その寺は今では町名にその名をとどめるだけだ. We only know of the temple now because its name forms part of the name of the town.
・名を惜しむ be keen to preserve one's reputation [good name]; hold one's reputation dear; be jealous of one's good name
・武士は命より名を惜しむものだ. For samurai a good name [reputation] was dearer than life. | The warrior class of Japan placed honor above life.
・名を落とす[汚す] lose [lower, spoil, compromise] one's reputation [good name]; stain one's name [honor]
・名を恥ずかしめる disgrace oneself; 〈事が主語〉 disgrace sb; be a blot on sb's good name [reputation]; be a discredit to sb
・母校の名を恥ずかしめる行為 behavior that disgraces [is a blot on the good name of] one's old school
・父の名を汚さぬようにしろ. Don't (do anything to) disgrace [be a disgrace to] your father. | 〔亡父の名を〕 See that you do not disgrace your father's memory.
・名を捨てて実を取る. Profit is better than fame. | It's better to be rich than famous.
●彼の名は国外にも聞こえている. His reputation extends beyond his own country. | He is well known abroad, too.
・彼女の名は長く人々の記憶に残るだろう. She [Her name] will not soon be forgotten. | She will long be remembered.
・人は一代名は末代. ⇒ひと1 3.
・功成り名遂げる do great work [achieve great things] and make a name for oneself
・彼はすでに功成り名遂げて今は悠々自適の日々である. He has already made a name for himself [proved himself], and so now he passes his days in leisure.
3 〔名目〕 a pretext; a plea; a pretense; a justification; 〔名義〕 a name.
●…とは名ばかりである only…in name; not a real…; …with no substance
・彼女にとって父親とは言え名ばかり[名のみ]だった. She had a father in name only.
・改革とは名ばかりの省庁再編 a restructuring of government ministries that is reform only in name [a merely nominal reform]; a reorganization of ministries and agencies that has no real substance [does not amount to a true reform]
・春とは名ばかり, 当地の 4 月はまだ雪の中だ. It's only spring in name; in April there is still snow here.
●…の名で in sb's name; using sb's name
・会社の名で購入する make a purchase in the company's name; buy 《a painting》 on the company.
●…の名において in [under] the name of…
・布教の名においてこれまでいくつもの文化が侵略され滅ぼされてきた. Many cultures have been overrun and destroyed in the name of missionary work.
・君のしていることは正義の名における個人的復讐だ. What you are doing is just revenge under the name of righteousness. | You are rationalizing revenge by calling it justice.
・福祉の名に隠れて under the cloak of good works.
●…という名の …in [by] name; under the name of…; nominal [nominally]…
・彼女は僕をボーイフレンドという名の運転手とでも思っているらしい. She seems to think I'm just a chauffeur under the name of a boyfriend [acting as boyfriend].
・…の[という]名のもとに under [in] the name [pretext] of…
・開発の名のもとに目を覆うような自然破壊が進められている. Outrageous environmental destruction is going on under the name of development. | Development is being used as a pretext for destruction of the environment.
●…に名を借りて in the name of…; under the guise of…; under [on] the pretext of…; disguised as…; posing as…
・聖戦に名を借りた虐殺 a massacre disguised [posing] as a holy war
・それは公共事業の名を借りた利権あさりだ. They call it a public works project, but it is really no more than jobbery. | It's really simply trying to corner jobs under the disguise of public works.
IIめい-【名-】
noted 《wrestler》; celebrated 《place》; distinguished 《leadership》; great 《work》; excellent 《pitcher》; star 《actor》; wise 《leader》; judicious 《decision》.
●名判事 an able judge; a Daniel.
III-めい【-名】
persons; people.
●20名 twenty people [persons].

《pay》 the price 《of…》; the cost; the charges; the money 《for…》; the bill; the fee.

すこしも【少しも】
(1)（打ち消しの語を伴って）ちっとも。 全然。
「あんなに努力したのに～成果が上がらない」
(2)わずかでも。 すこしでも。
「～かたちよしと聞きては， 見まほしうする人どもなりければ/竹取」

すこしも【少しも】
《not》 in the least; 《not》 at all; 《not》 in any degree; 《not》 a bit [whit]; 《not》 the slightest.
●少しも構わない do not care a bit [straw, fig, pin, scrap, 《口》 damn] 《about…, whether…》
・少しも役に立たない be of no use at all; be good for nothing; be absolutely useless
・少しも効き目がない have no effect what(so)ever [at all].
●世間の人が私のことをなんと言おうと少しも構わない. I don't care twopence [I couldn't care less] what people say about me.
・少しもけがをしなかった. He was not hurt at all [in the least].
・彼女はロシア語の知識が少しもない. She doesn't have the least [slightest] knowledge of Russian.
・彼には良心なんて少しもない. He has not an ounce [iota] of conscience.
・少しも間違っていない. You are not in the least bit mistaken. | 《口》 You're dead right.
・彼女にはユーモアが少しもない. She doesn't have a suspicion of humor. | She has no sense of humor whatsoever.
・6 月まで少しも雨が降らなかった. We didn't have a spot of rain till June.
・そんな考えは少しもない. Nothing could be farther from my intentions.
・君が私を裏切ろうとは少しも思わなかった. I didn't have the slightest inkling that you would betray me.
・それは少しも予期しなかった. That is the last thing I expected.
・計画は少しも先へ進まなかった. The plan did not go a single step farther.
・それについては少しも知らない. I know nothing at all about it.
・これはあれと比べて少しも劣らない. This is every bit as good as that.
・われわれはその点では彼らに少しもひけを取らない. We are (in) no whit inferior to them in that respect.
・そのことは少しも心配していない. I'm not in the slightest [at all] anxious about it.

おおざっぱ【大雑把】

●大雑把な性格 one's rough-and-ready manner; a more-or-less-is-good-enough disposition
・建築費用の大雑把な見積もりを出してくれ. Please give me a rough estimate of the building costs.

・大雑把に言うと色の地味な鳥のほうが声はよいようである. As a rough rule of thumb, less brightly colored birds seem to have better voices.

I じっぽん【日本】
〔「日本」の字音読みから〕
ヨーロッパにおける日本の呼称の一。 ［日葡］

II にっぽん【日本】
⇒ にほん（日本）

III にほん【日本】
〔「にっぽん」とも〕
我が国の国号。 アジア大陸の東方， 日本海を隔てて太平洋上にある。 北海道・本州・四国・九州の四大島と， 南西諸島・小笠原諸島などからなり， 弧状を描きほぼ南北に連なる。 国土の大部分は山地で， 人口は河川下流の平野に集中する。 面積37万8千平方キロメートル。 正称， 日本国。
〔古くは政権の所在地名「やまと」が日本の総称として用いられ， また， 中国・朝鮮では「倭」と記していた。 聖徳太子が隋に送った国書に「日出処天子」と記したのと同じ発想から「日本」を正式の国号としたのは大化頃からと思われ， 「やまと」「ひのもと」などと読まれていたが， 奈良・平安時代になると音読されることが多くなり， 「にほん」「にっぽん」の両様の発音が行われた。 昭和初期， 「にっぽん」に統一しようとする動きがあったが， 法的に制定されることなく現在に至っている。 本辞典では， 検索の便宜上「にほん」として配列した〕

IV にほん【日本】
陸羯南(クガカツナン)が1889年（明治22）東京で創刊した言論新聞。 国民主義を掲げ， 条約改正問題などで政府を批判， たびたび発禁処分となる。 1914年（大正3）廃刊。

・彼女になら何を打ち明けても大丈夫だ. You can safely [It's safe to] tell anything to her.
・カードさえあれば旅行は大丈夫. As long as you have a credit card you'll be all right when traveling. | It's safe to travel [There's no problem traveling] provided you have a credit card.
・その点は大丈夫です. There's no need to worry [You can relax] about that.
・この水は飲んでも大丈夫ですか. Is this water safe [OK] (to drink)?
・この件は彼に任せておけば大丈夫だ. It'll be safe in his hands. | If you leave it to him it'll be OK [go all right].
・よし, これで大丈夫. 〔戸締まりなどをして〕 Right [Fine, Good]. Now everything's OK [safe]. | 〔処置などを終えて〕 Fine [Right, Good]. Now everything's all right. [There's nothing more to worry about].
・戸締まりは大丈夫? Are all the doors and windows locked? | Are the doors and windows securely fastened? | Have you checked all the doors and windows?
・「盗まれないだろうか」「大丈夫だよ」 “Won't it get stolen?”―“No, it'll be OK [fine, perfectly safe].”
・彼女ならどの職場でも大丈夫だ. 〔勤まる〕 She'll be all right [do fine] in any job.
・彼ならどの大学でも大丈夫だ. 〔入れる〕 He'll be OK [《口》 a safe bet] for any university. | He'll be able to get in anywhere [into any university].
・そんなことを言って大丈夫なのか? Do you think you ought [Isn't it dangerous] to say that (sort of thing)? | Can you afford to say things like that? | You shouldn't say things like that. | 《口》 Watch your mouth.
・心配しなくていい, もう大丈夫. Don't worry. It's all right [OK, safe] now. | Don't worry any more. You're all right [OK, safe, out of danger].
・がんばれ! 僕がついているから大丈夫. Good luck! Don't worry; I'll be here. | Give it your best! You'll be fine. I'm with you.
2 〔確実に; 確かに〕 certainly; definitely; surely; infallibly; assuredly; undoubtedly; (念を押して) You can depend (up)on it that…; I assure you (that…); I promise you (that…).
●大丈夫, 勝てるさ. Don't worry! We'll win.
・大丈夫, うまく行くよ. You'll be OK. | Everything will go fine.
・大丈夫, 必ず来るよ. Relax. He'll definitely come. | Don't worry. He's sure to be here.
・大丈夫, 受かるよ. You'll definitely pass. | You're sure [certain] to pass.
・大丈夫, 明日は天気だ. I am sure it will be fine tomorrow. | Tomorrow will be fine. Don't worry.

I せんず【先ず】
人より先にする。 さきんずる。

II まず【先ず】
(1)他のことに先んじて。 最初に。 第一に。
「～私から報告いたします」
(2)何はともあれ。 ともかく。
「～一休み」
(3)だいたいのところ。 一応。 おおよそ。
「～これでよし」
(4)（打ち消しの語を伴って）ほとんど。
「～助からないだろう」「～来ないだろう」

まず【先ず】

1 〔最初に〕 first; first of all; before [above] everything; in the first place; to begin with; for [by way of] a start; for [as] a starter.
●まず…する begin by doing
・まず…してから after doing…first
・まず手始めに for a start; to begin with
・まず初めにお断りしておきますが,… To begin with, I would like to inform [remind] you that….
●まずやることをやってしまおう. First let's get everything done that has to be done.
・ではまず私からご挨拶申しあげます. Er, I'll start the ball rolling by saying a few words.
・まずこの間の事情を説明しよう. First, let me explain the recent situation.
・障害は多々あるが, まず第一には資金が足りない. There are any number of obstacles, and in the first place is our lack of capital.
・親は何よりもまず, 子供の幸福を考える. Parents put the happiness of their children before anything else.
・まずはこの問題からだ. Let's start with this problem.
・まずは酒だ. 話は後だ. Drink first. Talk later. | Let's have a drink to start with. Then let's talk.

2 〔ともあれ〕 anyway; anyhow. [⇒ひとまず]
●まずまずの出来 a fair [reasonable] result.
●買うかどうかは別にして, まずその品を拝見しましょう. Regardless of whether I buy it or not, let me see the article anyway.
・息子もようやく身を固めたし, まずこれでひと安心だ. Our son has finally (got married and) settled down, so now at least we can feel relieved.
・まずは一筆御礼まで. Anyway, please accept my thanks (in this letter).

3 〔おそらく〕 about; nearly; almost; practically; tolerably; 〔おそらく…ない〕 hardly; scarcely; 〔概して〕 on the whole.
●まずそんなところだ. That's about right.
・これならまず上出来と言ってよい. This is done fairly well.
・それですめばまず上等だ. The ending is reasonably satisfactory.
・彼ならまず学者としてやっていけるだろう. I suppose he could manage quite well as an academic.
・うまく行くと思ってまず差支えないだろう. You may be pretty sure that it will go well.
・彼が文句を言ってくるのはまず間違いない. It's pretty certain [You can be pretty sure] that he will complain.
・成功の見込みはまずない. Success is almost hopeless. | Success can hardly be expected.
・感染のおそれはまずないと思っていい. It is reasonable to assume that there is no chance of infection.
・そうなることはまずあるまい. It is almost certain that it will not happen.
・あれほどの人はまずいない. There are few, if any, like him.
・あの男が台所に立つことはまずない. He seldom, if ever, goes into the kitchen.
・まずあれだけ言っておけば心配あるまい. At least if you say all of that, there'll be nothing to worry about.

あんい【安易】
～な 〔気楽な〕 easy; easygoing; lighthearted; 〔いいかげんな〕 offhanded; sloppy; slipshod; careless; irresponsible.

・調停案に安易に応じるべきではない. You shouldn't be too quick to consent to the mediation [compromise] plan.

たいへん【大変】
1 ～な 〔深刻な〕 serious; grave; 〔非常な〕 terrible; horrible; awful; awesome; dreadful; 〔尋常でない〕 extraordinary; uncommon; unusual.
●大変なこと a serious matter; a matter of grave importance; 《be》 no joke
・大変なことになる become [get] serious; assume alarming proportions

・大変な費用 an enormous expense; a huge cost

・大変な考え違いだ. You're badly mistaken. | That's a serious misunderstanding.
・大変な暑さだ. It's awfully hot.
・物価は大変な上がりようだ. Prices are really shooting up. | Inflation is terrible.
・大変な美人と結婚する get married to a real beauty; marry an absolute stunner
・今夜は大変なごちそうだね. It's quite a meal [What a feast] tonight!
・課長に楯突いたとは大変な新人だね. A newcomer standing up to the section chief, we've got quite a person on our hands [that's pretty unusual].
●大変だ! 〔目前のものに対し〕 Oh my God! | My God! | Oh, my goodness! | Oh, no! | Oh dear! | Oh, hell! | Gracious! | Good gracious! | (Good) Heavens! | Goodness me! | How terrible! | What a disaster! | 〔人に知らせて〕 Help! | Quick! | Would you believe it?
・大変だ! 子どもが川に落ちた! Oh my God! [Help! Oh, no!] A child's fallen in the water!
・大変! もうこんな時間! Oh dear! [Heavens! Would you believe it?] It's that time already!
・大変,大変! お鍋がふきこぼれてる! Help, help! [Quick, quick!, Oh, hell!] The pot's boiling over.
・そんなことをしたら大変だ. Do that and you'll be in a mess. | It would be terrible if you did that.
・社長に知れたら大変だ. If my boss found out, I'd get into awful trouble.
・君にもしものことがあったら大変だ. It would be terrible if anything should happen to you! | What if anything should happen to you?
・やりそこなったら大変だ. If I mess things up, that'll be the end.
・見つかったら大変だ. If I'm found out, there'll be hell to pay.
2 ～な 〔ひどい〕 terrible; horrible; disastrous; 〔困難な〕 difficult; not easy; 〔苦しい〕 troublesome; trying; distressing.
●大変な目に遭う have a terrible experience [hard time]; face a difficult situation; have something terrible happen (to one)
・大変な目に遭ったよ. Something terrible has happened (to me). | I've gotten in an awful mess!
・まだまだ大変な仕事が残っている. We've still a lot of work to do. | There's still a lot left for us to do.
・大変な時は手を貸すから言ってくれ. I'll be happy to help in an emergency [when you need me], so just say so.
・今日は朝から大変な一日だった. What a day it's been [I've had]! | It's been quite a day today! | It was a trying [chaotic, hard, hectic] day from beginning to end.
・大変になる become difficult; get harder
・年を取るとだんだん歩くのが大変になる. The older you get, walking becomes more of an effort.
・庶民の暮らしはますます大変になってきた. Life for ordinary people has gotten harder (and harder).
・最近では原料の確保が大変になっている. Recently, it's been getting harder [we've been having (more) trouble] getting hold of the raw materials.
●食費が大変だ. The food expenses are heavy.
・準備がさぞ大変だったでしょう. I bet the preparations were a lot of trouble [took a lot of hard work]. | You must have gone to a lot of trouble [worked really hard] getting things ready.
・仕事と家事の両立はやはり大変だ. I'm afraid doing a job and running a household at the same time is a lot of hard work.
・さあ大変だ. This is really hard. | Now we're up against it. | There's a lot to get through.
・これからが大変だ. Now we've got to get down to business. | We've got a long way to go. | The worst is yet to come.
・「来週アブダビで, その次の週は南米に出張です」「大変ですね」 “I've got a business trip to Abu Dhabi next week, and South America the week after.”―“That's pretty hard (on you)! | You've got your work cut out, haven't you? | That's a pretty punishing schedule!”
・息子さんは今年受験ですか? 大変ですね. So your son's trying for university entrance this year? That's a lot of hard work (for you all). [I feel for you.]
・道がぬかるんで大変だ. 〔ひどい状態だ〕 The road is terribly muddy [so muddy it's terrible].
・会社が大変だ. The company is having a hard time [on the rocks, up against it].
・あの時代に反戦を唱えるのは大変なことだった. At the time, speaking out against the war was a serious thing to do [momentous undertaking].
3 〔(強意語として副詞的に)非常に〕 very; most; greatly; terribly; awfully; extremely; remarkably; extraordinarily.
●大変楽しかったです. 〔宴などが〕 It was immensely enjoyable [great fun].
・大変面白かったです. 〔本などが〕 It was extremely interesting [tremendously absorbing].
・大変喜ばれる be much appreciated; cause great delight
・彼は大変喜んだ. He was very pleased [highly delighted].
・大変苦労[心配]する work [worry] a lot; have a lot [no end] of trouble [worries]
・大変残念である. I am very sorry. | I do regret this. | It is a great pity [shame]. | This is most regrettable.
●その節は大変お世話になりました. You were very kind to me (on that occasion), and I am most grateful. | Thank you for being so kind to me at that time.
・大変ご迷惑をおかけしました. (I'm) sorry I've put [for putting, to have put] you to so much trouble. | I (do) apologize for causing so much trouble.
・ご好意は大変ありがたいのですが… I am very [most] grateful for your kind offer, but…. | It's very [extremely] kind of you, but….
・大変よくできました. 〔成績評価〕 Very good [well done]! | Excellent!
4 〔一大事〕 an emergency; a serious matter [incident]; an urgent situation; a crisis.
●国家の大変 a matter of national importance; a crisis for the nation.
大変さ 〔困難さ〕 (great) trouble; (a) difficulty; how hard things are; 〔苦労〕 (a) hardship; distress; trials and tribulations.
●農作業の大変さ the hardship(s) of agricultural work
・私もようやく親の大変さがわかる年になった. I have finally reached an age when I appreciate the trouble my parents went through [how hard things were for my parents].
大変に 〔非常に〕 very; most; greatly; terribly; awfully; extremely; remarkably; extraordinarily.
●大変に遺憾である. It is most regrettable. | I regret it deeply. | It is deeply to be regretted.
・大変に名誉なことだ. It is a great honor 《for me to…, that…》.
・わが国を取り巻く状況は大変に厳しい. The country finds itself in a very serious situation.

「 たいへん 」
☆ int
☆ chết rồi; không xong rồi; kinh khủng quá.v.v...
☆ 大変だ！学校が火事だぞ。: Kinh khủng quá, trường tôi cháy rồi.

☆ 彼女は平均台の演技で大変なミスをしてしまった。: Cô ấy đã mắc một sai lầm ghê gớm khi biểu diễn trên cầu thăng bằng.
☆ mệt mỏi; khó khăn; vất vả
☆ 夜遅くまで勉強とは大変だね。: Học đến khuya quả là vất vả nhỉ.
☆ quá

☆ vô cùng; rất
☆ 京都の冬は大変寒い。: Mùa đông ở Kyoto vô cùng lạnh.

あんがい【案外】
※一※ （名・形動）
(1)予想していたことと違うさま。 予想外だ。 意外だ。
「叔母は～な顔をして/門（漱石）」
(2)無礼なこと。 ふとどき。 慮外。
「～なる素野郎(スヤロウ)め/浄瑠璃・先代萩」
※二※ （副）
思いのほか。 意外にも。
「やってみれば～うまくいくものだ」

あんがい【案外】
not as expected; beyond expectation; unexpectedly; surprisingly; to one's surprise; more…than one expects [thinks, hopes, fears].
～な unexpected; unanticipated; unlooked-for; unthought-of; unforeseen; surprising.
●去年の優勝者が一回戦で敗退するとは案外だった. It came as a shock that last year's champion(s) went out in the first round.
・彼女には案外な一面がある. There is an unsuspected [unexpected] side to her character.
・案外よくない成績 an unexpectedly poor result; a disappointing result
・案外に思う be surprised 《at a result, etc.》
・勝負は案外時間がかかった. The match took rather an unexpectedly long time to finish. | It took longer than expected to finish the game.
・工事は案外早くできあがった. The work was completed earlier than expected.
・そいつは案外難しいぞ. That'll be harder than you think.
・兄の病気は案外重い. My brother is more seriously ill than I imagined.
・損失は案外少なかった. The loss was less than we (had) feared. | We didn't lose as much as we had been afraid we would.
・あの男は案外よい男かもしれない. He may be a better man than we think.
・案外だめな人間だ. He is disappointing as a person.
・彼は案外利口者だ. He is cleverer than I gave him credit for.
・重病だと聞いて帰省してみたら, 父は案外元気だった. Hearing my father was seriously ill, I went back home, but fortunately it turned out that he was healthier than I expected.
・東京の都心部に温泉があることは案外知られていない. Surprisingly few people know that there are hot springs in central Tokyo.

☆ bất ngờ; không tính đến; không ngờ
☆ 案外難しい: không ngờ lại khó thế

I にゅうぼう【女房】
にょうぼう。
「さもいつくしき～たち/仮名草子・恨の介」
〔「にうばう」は室町から江戸初期に多く見られる表記で， 「にょうぼう」と読まれたものと思われる〕

II にょうぼ【女房】
〔「にょうぼう（女房）」の転〕
「にょうぼう（女房）{(1)}」に同じ。

III にょうぼう【女房】
〔「房」は部屋の意。 女官の部屋が原義。 「にょう」は慣用音〕
(1)妻。 自分の妻のことをいう場合に多く用いられる。 にょうぼ。
「～の尻に敷かれる」
(2)宮中に仕え， 房（＝部屋）を与えられて住む女官の総称。 出身階級によって上臈・中臈・下臈に大別される。 また， 院や諸宮・貴人の家などに仕える女性をもいう。
「家の御達， ～などのうかがふを/枕草子 3」
(3)女性， また愛情の対象としての女性をいう。 中世・近世の用法。
「あたりの～をかたらふて， ただ今これへおしよせらるる/狂言・髭櫓」
～と畳は新しい方が良い
女房と畳は新しい方がすがすがしくてよい。
～の妬(ヤ)くほど亭主(テイシユ)もてもせず
女房は自分の亭主をもてるものと思ってやきもちを焼くが， 女房の思うほどもてることはない， ということ。

にょうぼう【女房】

1 〔妻〕 a wife 《pl. wives》; 《口》 one's better half; one's old woman. [⇒つま2]
●女房面([sub]づら[/sub])をする act like sb's wife; behave as if she were sb's wife.
●女房の尻に敷かれる be hen-pecked; be tied to one's wife's apron strings
・女房の悪いのは六十年の不作. A bad wife is the shipwreck of her husband. [⇒あくさい2]
●女房を持つ[もらう] get married; take a wife; marry a woman
・(人に)女房を持たせる get sb a wife; get sb married
・女房を寝取られる become a cuckold; wear the horns
・女房を泣かす treat one's wife badly
・女房を質に入れてでもこの釣り竿は手に入れたい. I want this fishing rod so much I'd put my wife in hock [do anything I can, go to any possible means] to get it.
●女房と畳は新しいほうがよい. A wife and tatami are both best new.

2 〔昔の宮中の, 女官〕 a court lady; a lady in waiting.
恋女房 the wife I love; my beloved [darling] wife.
世話女房 ⇒せわにょうぼう.
古女房 my [the] old woman.
●今は古女房と二人暮らしです. The old woman and I are alone now.
女房運
●女房運が悪い 〔悪妻に苦しめられる〕 be cursed with a bad wife; have no luck [be unlucky] with wives; 〔何度も妻に先立たれる〕 outlive one's wives.
女房孝行
●女房孝行の亭主 an uxorious [a doting, a devoted] husband.
女房詞([sub]ことば[/sub]) 〔昔の宮中の〕 the court-lady language.
女房持ち a married man.

☆ n
☆ vợ

☆ オレ、何か中年の危機にいるような気がする...仕事は面白くないし、女房と一緒にいる時間も楽しめなくてなあ。: Tôi cảm thấy có nguy cơ già đi...công việc thì không thấy thú vị, và không có thời gian vui chơi cùng vợ

ちいさな【小さな】
〔形容動詞「ちひさなり」の連体形から〕
現代語では， 連体形「ちいさな」の形だけが用いられる。 小さいさま。
⇔ 大きな
「～箱」「規模の～会社」
〔「ちいさな」を連体詞とする説もあるが， この語は「手の小さな人」などのように， 述語としてのはたらきをもっている点が， 一般の連体詞とは異なっている〕
小さな政府
政府の役割， 規模の肥大化が， 経費の増大や非効率を生んでいると批判し， 政府の役割・事業等を縮小して財政経費を減らし， 市場にゆだねようとする考え方。

ちいさな【小さな】
＝ちいさい.

たいしかん【大使館】
駐在国において， 大使が事務を執る館舎。 国際法では， 本国の領地と同一にみなされ， 不可侵権をもつ。

たいしかん【大使館】
an embassy.
●アメリカ[イギリス]大使館 the American [British] Embassy
・在米日本大使館 the Japanese Embassy in Washington.
●大使館付き海軍武官 a naval attaché to an embassy
・大使館付き陸軍武官 a military [an army] attaché to an embassy.
●紛失したパスポートの再発行を現地の大使館に願い出る apply for replacement of a lost passport at the embassy in the country where one is.
●大使館を開設する open an embassy 《in…》
・大使館を置く have [keep] an embassy 《in…》.
大使館員 (a member of) embassy staff.
●大使館員である be on an embassy staff.
大使館参事官 a counsel(l)or of an embassy.
大使館事務局 a chancery; a chancellory; a chancellery.
大使館書記官 a secretary of an embassy.

こうしょう【高尚】
知性や品性の程度が高いこと。 気高くて， 立派なこと。 また， そのさま。
⇔ 低俗
「～な趣味」
﹛派生﹜～さ（名）

こうしょう【高尚】
～な 〔(上品で)学問･言行などの程度が高い〕 advanced; intellectual; sophisticated; of (a) high tone; 《口》 high-brow; 〔上品な〕 refined; elevated; elegant; graceful.
●高尚な人 a noble soul [mind]; a sophisticated person; an intellectual; 《口》 a highbrow
・高尚な目的 lofty aims [objectives, purposes]
・高尚な趣味 elegant [cultivated] tastes; sophisticated [《口》 highbrow] tastes
・高尚な趣味を持つことはぜいたくな暮らしをすることではない. Having elegant taste does not mean living in elegance.
・高尚な文学 refined [elegant] literature; sophisticated [《口》 high-brow] literature
・高尚な文体 a refined [an elegant] style; an intellectual [《口》 a highbrow] style
・高尚な雑誌 a high-toned [《口》 highbrow] magazine
・高尚な話題 an intellectual [《口》 a highbrow] topic; a lofty topic [problem, question]; a problem for intellectuals; the sort of problem that intellectuals like to talk about
・高尚にする improve oneself [one's mind, sb's mind]; adopt a higher [more intellectual, 《口》 a more high-brow] tone; raise the tone 《of a conversation》; refine 《one's tastes》; polish 《one's [sb's] style》; make 《a topic》 more intellectual [sophisticated, 《口》 highbrow]
・高尚ぶる put on [assume] lofty [《口》 highbrow] airs; 《口》 come the intellectual.
●彼の言うことは高尚すぎて一般大衆にはわからない. He speaks over ordinary people's heads. | His language is too sophisticated [intellectual, high-toned, high-brow] for ordinary people to understand.
・その書物は内容が非常に高尚である. It is an extremely learned [sophisticated, 《口》 high-brow] book.

a fund; a foundation; an endowment; (国債･公債) public funds.
●基金に繰り入れる add to a fund; put into a fund.
●彼女はこの大学の基金の寄贈者である. She has given an endowment to [is a benefactress of] this college.

・基金を募る raise [collect] money for a fund; raise funds 《for…》
・大学に基金を贈る donate a fund to a university [《米》 college]; make [give] an endowment to a university [《米》 college].

.

どうじ【同時】
(1)時を同じくすること。
(2)時代が同じであること。

どうじ【同時】
1 〔同じ時刻〕 the same time [hour].
●同時に at the same time [hour].
2 〔同じ時･時期〕
●同時に at the same time; simultaneously 《with…》; in the same instant; concurrently [in concurrence] 《with…》; synchronously; coincidentally; coincidently
・…と同時に起こる coincide with…; occur at the same time as…; synchronize with…
・地震と同時に土砂崩れが起こった. The earthquake was accompanied by [brought with it] landslides.
・同時に 2 つのポストにつく 〔兼職する〕 hold two positions concurrently
・私と彼女は同時に大学に入った. She and I entered university at the same time. | I entered university at the same time as she did.
・ナポレオンの没落と同時に長い間の戦争が終わりを告げた. With Napoleon's fall ended the long war.
・父が帰宅すると同時に母は出かけて行った. Mother went out the moment Father came home.
●同時の simultaneous; concurrent; synchronous; contemporaneous 《with…》.
●2 人のゴールインはほとんど同時だった. They crossed the line almost simultaneously.
3 〔ともに〕 at the same time…; 〔一方では〕 while…; on the other hand; but at the same time….
●自分の中に変化を求める気持ちと現状を維持したいという気持ちが同時に存在する. Within me there coexist a desire for change and a wish to maintain the status quo [keep things as they are].
・この本は読者の興味をかきたてると同時に示唆的でもある. This book both arouses the reader's interest and is instructive (at the same time).
・登山は健康にいいが同時に危険も伴う. Mountaineering is a healthy sport, but a dangerous one, too.
・彼の長所は認めるが同時に短所にも目をつぶるわけにいかない. While I admit his good points I cannot shut my eyes to his faults.
同時作動式の synchro 《camera shutters》.
同時進行 going on [moving] simultaneously; synchronism; synchronicity.
●2 つの料理を同時進行でつくる prepare two dishes at the same time [at once, concurrently]
・衛星中継により, 世界中の人々が同時進行で戦争の経過を逐一追うことができた. The whole world was able to follow by satellite transmission the details of each developing event of the war simultaneously as it unfolded.
・録画再生同時進行 simultaneous recording and playback.
同時性 simultaneity; synchronism; synchronicity.
同時選挙 〔衆議院と参議院の〕 simultaneous elections [a double election] (for the House of Representatives and the House of Councillors).

I ぜんご【前後】
(1)（空間や位置的に）物のまえとうしろ。

(2)（時間的に）ある事柄のさきとあと。

(3)物事や出来事のあとさきの状況・事情。

(4)年代・時間・年齢や， 数量を表す語などに付いて， それにごく近いことを表す。 ぐらい。 ごろ。 内外。

(5)順序が逆になること。
「話が～する」
(6)間を置かず物事が行われること。 また， 起こること。 相前後すること。
「両人は～してやって来た」

途方に暮れる。
「～・れてぞ見えにける/浄瑠璃・国性爺合戦」
～を失・う
⇒ 前後を忘れる

～を忘・れる
自分の置かれている状況がわからなくなる。 また， 正体がなくなる。 前後を失う。 前後を忘(ボウ)ずる。

II まえしりえ【前後】

Iぜんご【前後】
1 〔空間的に物の前と後〕
●前後に敵を受ける be attacked from both the front and the rear; receive frontal and rear attacks by the enemy

・意味のわからない単語があっても, 前後の関係から文意はわかることがある. Even if there are words you don't know, you can often guess the meaning of a text [passage, sentence] from the context.
・車に突っ込まれた車両の前後の車両も脱線した. The carriages in front of and behind the one hit by the car were also derailed.
・乗客は全員前後の扉からいっせいに逃げた. All the passengers escaped through the doors in front and behind.
●前後を見回す look (all) around [about] one; look in both directions; look in front and behind [《文》 before and after]
・前後を入れ替える change the order 《of》; put 《the names》 in a different order; 〔逆にする〕 reverse the order 《of》; change 《the two names》 around
・パトカーに前後を守られる be protected in front and behind by police cars.
2 〔時間的にある時の前と後〕 before and after 《six o'clock》; in advance and afterward; 〔ある事柄の前と後〕 before and after 《the event》; in advance and afterward.
●バブル崩壊の前後では地価に大きな変化が見られる. Major changes in land prices are observed before and after [either side of] the collapse of an economic bubble.

・事故の前後の記憶がない. I have no memory of what happened just before or after the accident.

●10 月 1 日の前後を通じて 3 か月以上にわたって居住している人は国勢調査の対象になる. The census covers anyone living at an address for at least three months before or after 1st October.
●手術の前後は患者はよく眠れないことが多い. Patients often have difficulty sleeping before and [or] after an operation.
・列車が一番混むのはお盆の前後ですね. It's around Bon that the trains get most crowded, isn't it?
3 〔ちょうどそのころ〕
●私は例年桜の開花前後に畑仕事を始める. I always start working in the fields just when the cherries start flowering.
・夏休みの前後になれば客ももっと増えるでしょう. There will probably be more customers when the summer vacation starts.

●前後を顧みる reflect on [think of] the consequences
・前後を忘れる forget oneself; be beside oneself 《with grief》; be oblivious of everything around one.
●疲れた私はそのまま前後も知らず眠り続けた. I was so tired that I just slept on regardless.

・話が前後している. The story [Your account] is mixed up. | You are telling the story in the wrong order [back to front].
・紹介が前後する start before introducing 《sb》 [doing the introductions]; forget to introduce sb.
●前後が逆だ. They are back to front. | The order is [Things are] the wrong way around.
●それは前後転倒だ. That's an instance of putting the cart before the horse.
6 〔両者相続くこと〕

II-ぜんご【-前後】

II やけど【火傷】

●手をやけどする get burnt in the hand; burn one's hand

・素人([sub]しろうと[/sub])が株に手を出すと得てしてやけどするものだ. When an amateur starts playing with stocks, all he's going to get is burned fingers.
●手のやけど a burn on one's hand

●大やけどをする be badly burned

おおい【多い】
(1)物の数や量がたくさんある。 豊富だ。
「人口が～・い」「最近交通事故が～・い」
(2)一定の分量の中で占める割合が大である。 大半だ。
「～・くは誤解による中傷だ」「～・くの人はそう思っている」
(3)数量・度数が相対的に大である。
「彼の方が給料が～・い」
⇔ すくない
〔古く「おほし」は「多」「大」の両方の意味を表したが， 後に「多し」と「大きなり」に分化した。 平安時代の和文では， 終止形「多かり」， 連体形「多かる」， 已然形「多かれ」が用いられ， 漢文訓読では， 「多し」「多き」「多けれ」が用いられた〕
﹛派生﹜～さ（名）

おおい【多い】
1 〔数が〕 a lot [《口》 lots] of…; many; a large number of 《people》; numerous; 《文》 multitudinous.
●今日は来客がかなり多かった. We have had quite a lot of [quite a large number of, a considerable number of] visitors today.
・日本人には英語を話せる人が多い. Many [A lot] of the Japanese speak English. | There are many [a lot of] English speakers among the Japanese.
・この川にはマスが多い. There are a lot of trout in this river. | This river teems with trout. | This river abounds in [with] trout.
・スズメは日本に多い鳥です. The sparrow is a common bird in Japan. | There are a lot of sparrows in Japan.
・その博物館には日本の古画が多い. The museum has a large number of old Japanese pictures. | There are many [a lot of] ancient Japanese pictures in the museum.
・その森には狩猟鳥獣が多い. The forest abounds in [is full of] game.
・その庭園には珍しい樹木が多い. The garden is stocked with rare trees. | There are a large number of unusual trees in the garden.
・この町は緑が多い. This town is very green. | There are a lot of green areas [is a lot of greenery] in this town.
・あの本は誤植が多い. That book has a lot [is full] of misprints. | There are a lot [large number] of misprints in that book.
・あれは欠点の多い男だ. He's a man of [with] many faults. | He has many [a lot] of shortcomings.
・今年の入学志願者は非常に多かった. There were an extremely large number of candidates (for entry) this year.
・この庭園の花の色は赤と深紅色が多い. Most of the flowers in this garden are red or scarlet. | Red and scarlet are the dominant colors among the flowers in this garden.
・あの人は子供が多い. She has a lot of children [large family].
・この大学では女子学生のほうが男子学生よりずっと多い. At this college there are far more women students than men students [female students far outnumber male students].
・この町を訪れる外国人観光客で一番多いのはアメリカ人で, その次に多いのはドイツ人である. Among the foreign tourists that visit this town the most numerous are Americans, and Germans second.
・多ければ多いほどよい. The more, the better.
2 〔量が〕 a lot [《口》 lots] of…; much; a large amount [quantity] of 《beer》.
●このごろは雨が非常に多い. There has been a lot [great deal] of rain lately. | It has rained a lot [great deal] recently.
・この地域は雨が多い. It rains a lot in this area. | There is copious [plentiful] rain in this area.
・その国は石油の埋蔵量が多い. The country has rich oil reserves [is rich in oil].
・あの家では主人より奥さんのほうの稼ぎが多い. In that household the wife has a bigger income [earns more] than the husband.
3 〔頻度･割合が〕 frequent; common.
●地震[暴風雨]が多い 〈土地が主語〉 be subject to [have] frequent earthquakes [storms]; be earthquake-[storm-]prone; often have earthquakes [storms].
●この病気は小児に多い. This disease is common [commonly occurs] in children. | Children are particularly subject to this disease.
・ここはいつもこんなに交通事故が多いのですか. Do traffic accidents always occur so frequently here? | Are there always so many traffic accidents here?
・不祥事の処理をトカゲのしっぽ切りで済ますというのは日本の社会に多いパターンだ. To deal with scandals by sacrificing a lower member of the organization (to save the others) is (a) common practice in Japanese society.
・自分の思いどおりにならないとすぐキレるというのが, 最近の若者に多い. It has become a common behavior pattern among the young recently to snap [lose all self-control] when they don't get their own way.
・彼女は照れ屋で人前に出ると無口になってしまうことが多い. She's bashful and tends to clam up [is often taciturn] in front of people.
・日曜日は結局何もしないで過ごすことが多い. On Sundays I tend to end up spending the day doing nothing [more often than not, I end up doing nothing the whole day].
多かれ少なかれ ⇒おおかれすくなかれ.
多く ⇒おおく.
多くとも, 多くて at (the) most; at the outside; at the very most.
●この事故による死者は多くとも 30 名を超えることはあるまい. The number of deaths arising from this accident is most unlikely to exceed thirty.
・立候補者は多くて 10 名にとどまる見込みである. It is anticipated that there will be no more than ten candidates at most.
多くなる 〔数が〕 increase [grow] (in number); 《the number of people》 increase [grow]; multiply; 〔量が〕 increase [grow] (in amount [quantity]); 《the quantity of beer》 increase [grow].

じかん【時間】
(1)時の長さ。 時の流れのある一点からある一点まで。
「復旧までには， まだかなりの～を要する」「食事をとる～もない」「勝敗が決するのは～の問題だ」
(2)時の流れのある一点。 時刻。
「集合～」「もう終わる～だ」
(3)時間の単位。 三六〇〇秒。 助数詞的にも用いる。
「飛行機だと二～で行ける」
(4)学校などで， 授業の単位として設けた， 一定の長さの時。 時限。 助数詞的にも用いる。
「国語の～」「三～目」
(5)〔哲〕 空間とともに世界を成立させる基本形式。 普通， 出来事や意識の継起する流れとして認識され， 過去・現在・未来の不可逆な方向をもつ。 理念・精神・神など超時間的な永遠の存在を認める立場では， 生成変化する現象界（事物）の性質とみなされる。 また， 先天的な直観形式だとする考え（カント）， 物質の根本的な存在形式としての客観的実在だとする考え（唯物論）などがある。
(6)〔物〕 自然現象の経過を記述するための変数。 古典力学で用いられる時間（絶対時間）は， 二つの事象の間の時間経過の長さが， 座標系（観測者）に依らず一定である。 相対性理論では， 時間は空間とともに四次元時空を形成し， 観測者に対して運動する座標系での時間は， ゆっくり経過すると観測される。 また一般相対性理論によれば， 時間経過の長さは， 重力の大きさによっても影響される。
～の問題
結果はほぼ分かっていて， あとはただその時を待っているだけである状態。
「妥結は～だ」
～を割(サ)・く
余裕のない時間をやりくりして他の事柄に使う。

あたりまえ【当(た)り前】
〔「当然」の当て字「当前」を訓読みした語〕
(1)だれが考えてもそうであるべきだと思うこと。 当然なこと。 また， そのさま。
「困っている人を助けるのは～のこと」
(2)普通と変わっていない・こと（さま）。 世間なみ。 なみ。
「～の人間」「～にやっていたのでは成功しない」

あたりまえ【当たり前】

1 〔当然〕 ～の proper; right; just; fair; (as a matter) of course; 〔もっともな〕 justifiable; reasonable; 〔自然な･不思議でない〕 natural; not strange.
●当たり前のこと a matter of course
・日本人が日本語を話すのは当たり前のことだ. It's not [It's hardly] surprising that Japanese people speak Japanese. | There's nothing surprising in somebody Japanese being able to speak Japanese. | Obviously [Of course] Japanese people can speak Japanese. | Japanese people should be [ought to be] able to speak Japanese.
・忘れ物を届けるという当たり前のことをしただけです. そんなに恐縮しないでください. I just did what anybody would've done in the circumstances and brought you what you'd left behind. There's really no need to thank me so profusely.
・正直に事実を話すのは人間として当たり前のことだ. For a human being to say honestly what really happened is simply right. | People [We] should simply tell the honest truth. | It is simply obvious that one should tell the unvarnished truth.
・たばこは有害だという当たり前のことがまだわからないのか. Do you still not understand the simple fact that cigarettes are harmful? | Don't you even realize that cigarettes are obviously harmful? | You don't even have the common sense to realize that cigarettes are bad for you?
・当たり前のことだと思う take 《it》 for granted
・卒業したら就職するのは当たり前のことだと思っていた. I had taken it for granted that people would get a job when they graduated [that anybody who had been to university could get a job].
・性能がよくて安い商品が売れるのは当たり前のことだと思う. It seems obvious [natural] to me that high-quality, low-priced goods should sell. | I don't think there is anything odd about good, cheap goods selling well.
●2 と 2 を足せば 4 になるのは当たり前だ. Two and two obviously make four. | Obviously, 2 and 2 make 4.
・それは当たり前さ. That goes without saying. | That's obvious [not surprising].
・彼が人からあのように同情されるのは当たり前だ. It's not surprising that people sympathize with him like that. | He deserves the sympathy he's receiving.
・君がそんな目にあうのは当たり前だ. It serves you right. | 《口》 You got what was coming to you. | You've brought it on yourself.
・彼が怒るのは当たり前だ. It's natural that he should be [get] angry. | He has good reason to be angry. | His anger is natural [not surprising].
・あいつが怒るのも, 当たり前といえば当たり前だ. It's hardly surprising that he got angry. | Perhaps it was only to be expected that he would lose his temper.
・この程度の漢字は書けて当たり前だ. Anyone [You] should be able to write this level of kanji.
・「怒った?」「当たり前さ」 “Are you angry?”―“Of course (I am).” | “Are you angry?”―“Obviously. What do you think?”
・「君も今度の計画に参加するかい?」「当たり前さ」 “Are you taking part in this project, too?”―“Of course [Naturally, Obviously, 《口》 Sure].” <▲> Obviously は「もちろん, 訊くまでもない」の意.
・「ここは車を止められないな」「当たり前だろ, 消防署の前じゃないか」 “We can't stop here.”―“Obviously (not). It's right in front of the fire station.”

2 〔普通〕 ～の ordinary; average; normal; usual; 《英》 《口》 common or garden.
●ごく当たり前の absolutely normal; completely unexceptional [normal]; taken completely for granted; not strange in any way
・それはごく当たり前のキーホルダーだった. It was just a very [completely] ordinary key ring.
・当たり前のことを当たり前にやる do ordinary [everyday] things in the ordinary [everyday, usual] way
・当たり前の手段ではだめだ. We [They] won't be able to solve the problem in the ordinary way [without taking special measures]. | The usual method will be useless.
・親が年とって子供の世話になるのは当たり前のことだ. There is nothing odd about parents depending on their children as they grow older. | It is normal for the elderly to get help from their children. | Elderly parents should [ought to] be able to depend on their children.
●当たり前でない unusual; odd; strange; extraordinary.
●当たり前ならもう課長になっているところだ. He ought to be a [the] section chief by now. | In the normal way of things he would be a [the] section chief by now.
当たり前に in the ordinary way; in the normal course of events; 〔常のように〕 as usual.
●当たり前にやったのではとても彼にはかなわない. I would be no match for him if we played (in) the normal way [if we played fair].
・今日も当たり前に学校へ行った. They went to school today as usual.

II きん【金】
中国， 女真族完顔(ワンヤン)部の酋長阿骨打(アクダ)が建てた国（1115-1234）。 遼(リヨウ)・北宋を滅ぼし中国東北部・内モンゴル・華北を領有した。 都は初め会寧府， のち燕京， 汴京(ベンケイ)。 モンゴルと南宋の攻撃により滅亡。

・あいつの金庫には金がうなるほど[腐るほど]入っている. There's piles [《口》 wads, oodles] of money in that guy's safe.

・家がほしいが金がない. I want a house of my own but I don't have the money [can't afford it].
・金がないから旅行はだめだ. I can't go travelling around; I don't have the money. | I'm not rich enough to go on trips.
・君は金がないんだろう. 僕がおごるよ. You don't have any money, right? I'll pay [This is on me].
・金ができる grow [get] rich; make money

・ようやく商売を始める金ができた. I've finally got hold of the money to start a business.

・彼女はいつも 100 万単位の金が自由になる. She has access to millions (of yen) at any time. | She can use [make use of] millions at any time.
・金がたまる come to have some money saved
・ちっとも金がたまらない. I never get any richer. | I can't save (up) at all. | Money simply doesn't accumulate.
・車の修理に金が要る. I need money for car repairs.
・歯の治療には金がかかる. Dental treatment is expensive. | It costs a lot (of money) to get dental treatment.
・それには時間と金が相当かかる. It takes [needs, requires] considerable time and money.
・それにはだいぶ金がかかっている. It has cost a lot of money. | A lot of money has been spent on it.
・この庭には少々金がかかりました. It took some [a bit of] money to make this garden. | 《口》 This garden set me back a bit [pretty penny].
・金があり余っている have more money than one can spend [knows what to do with]; have plenty of money to spare; have lots [tons, heaps, a mint] of money; be rolling in money
・これを仕上げたら金がもらえる. I'll get paid when I finish this. | When this is finished, I'll get [receive] some [the] money.
・金が払えそうもない. There's no way I'll be able to pay.
・これ以上金が続かない. I can't spend any more money 《on…》.
・その契約をめぐって金が動いた. There was money involved (behind the scenes) in getting that contract.
・審査員に金が流れたようだ. The judges got paid [bribed], it seems. | It looks as if the judges got some money.
・ふしぎと彼のところに金が集まる. I don't know how he does it, but he somehow attracts money [money just sticks to him somehow].
・金が目当て ⇒かねめあて

・金が敵([sub]かたき[/sub])の世の中だ. It is money that is [Money is] the bane of life.
・人生, 金がすべてではない. Money isn't everything [the only thing in life]. | There are other things (in life) besides money.
・金が多いと苦労も多い. Having a lot of money means having a lot of trouble.
・金が子を産む. Money makes money.

・金でうんと言わせる use money to get sb to agree; bribe sb to agree

・彼は反対勢力を金で黙らせた. He silenced the opposition with money [bribes, bribery]. | He bought off the opposition.
・金で済むことならいくらでも出す. If money can settle it I don't mind how much I spend. | I'll go to any expense to settle it.

●金に縁のない連中 people who have no luck with money

Iおおごと【大事】
a serious matter [affair]; something big [bigger than expected]; a major disaster.
●大事にならずに済んでよかった. We're lucky it didn't turn into a major disaster.
・大事にならなければよいのだが. I hope it won't turn into something big [serious, disastrous].
・この件は大事にはしたくない. ぜひ穏便に片をつけてくれ. I don't want this to turn into something big. I want you to take care of it quietly.
・放っておいたら大事になるところでした. If it had been left unattended to a little longer, we would have had a big problem on our hands.
・こりゃ大事になったぞ. Hey, this is serious!
●女房にこのことがばれたら大事だ. If this gets out to my wife all hell will break loose.
IIだいじ【大事】
1 〔大事業〕 a great [an important] task [undertaking, enterprise]; 〔大きなこと〕 an important [a difficult] thing [matter].
●大事を企てる attempt a great undertaking
・大事を成す achieve a great thing
・大事を決行する (resolutely) carry out an important enterprise.
●大事は小事より起こる. From small beginnings come great things. | All great things have a small beginning. | Great oaks from little acorns grow. 【諺】
2 〔重大事〕 a matter of grave concern; a serious [grave] matter; a matter of great moment; a serious consequence; 〔深刻な事態〕 a crisis 《pl. crises》; an emergency. [＝おおごと]
●一大事 ⇒いちだいじ
・国家の大事 a matter of grave national concern
・お家の大事 a matter of grave concern to the family [company, party, school, organization].
●大事になる turn into something serious; lead to a serious situation
・大事にならずに済んでよかった. It's a good thing it didn't turn into something serious.
・医療現場では小さなミスから大事に至る場合もある. In the practice of medicine, a minor mistake sometimes has serious consequences.
・火は大事に至る前に消し止められた. The fire was put out before it led to something serious.
・すみやかに修理が行われたため, 大事に至らずに済んだ. A disaster was prevented by speedy repair of the damage.
●大事を引き起こす cause a disaster; cause a serious trouble
・私の不用意な一言がこんな大事を引き起こすとは. I never imagined my thoughtless remark would cause a serious problem like this.
大事の前の小事 〔大事の前の(やむを得ない)小さな犠牲〕 a small sacrifice for a great cause; 〔大事を前にして小事に見えるもの〕 a trifling matter in view of the great undertaking involved; 〔大事の前には油断禁物〕 Small leaks (can) sink big ships.
大事を取る 〔自重する〕 be prudent; be circumspect; act with prudence; 〔用心する〕 be careful; be cautious; use caution; act cautiously; play (it) safe; try [prefer] to be on the safe side; take no chances.
●大事を取って to be prudent; by way of precaution; as a matter of prudence; to be on the safe side
・大事を取って医者に行った. To be on the safe side she went to see a doctor.
・大事を取りすぎる be overcautious
・大事を取るに越したことはない. It is always best to err [be] on the safe side.
IIIだいじ【大事】
1 ～な 〔かけがえのない･大切な〕 important; of importance [consequence]; momentous; weighty; precious; highly esteemed [prized]; valuable; a jewel of 《a son》; 《a person》 dear to one's heart.
●母からもらった大事な品 a precious item from [given me by] my mother
・命の次に大事な物 a thing that is the most precious [important, valuable] after life (itself)
・私の大事な人 a person whom I hold dear; a person I cherish [treasure].
2 ～な 〔重要な･肝心な〕 (very) important; essential; vital; critical; crucial.
●彼と大事な話がある. I have something important to talk over [discuss] with him.
・大事な話だからよく聞いてくれ. Listen carefully, because this is important.
・それは彼の一身上に関する大事なことだ. It is a matter of great personal importance to him.
・何よりも体が大事だ. Health is more important than anything else. | Health comes before all else. | Health is the first consideration.
・いいか, ここが大事な点だ. Listen carefully now, because this is the crucial point.
・それが一番大事な点だ. That's the most important [critical, essential] point.
・大事なことから先にやれ. Start with the important things. | Put first things first.
・いかん, 大事な用を忘れていた. Darn! I've forgotten to do something very important.
大事に
●大事にしまっておく treasure (up); keep in a safe place; 〔鍵のかかる所に〕 keep sth under lock and key
・お体お大事に. Take (good) care of yourself. | Take care.
大事にする 〔丁寧に扱う〕 treat with care [considerately]; take good care of…; 〔大切に思う〕 prize; value; set great value on…; cherish; esteem (highly); think [make] much of…; set store by…; attach value [importance] to….
●体を大事にする take (good) care of oneself
・目を大事にする save one's eyes
・部下を大事にする be considerate toward(s) [value] one's subordinates
・子供を大事にしすぎるからあんなにわがままになるんだ. You coddle [pamper] your children, and that's why they turned out so selfish [spoiled].
・奥さんを大事にしないと罰([sub]ばち[/sub])が当たるよ. You'll pay dearly for it later if you don't cherish [treasure, take good care of] your wife.
・「私なんか生きる資格はない」「そんなこと言わずにもっと自分を大事にしなさい」 “I don't deserve to be alive.”―“Nonsense! Stop selling yourself short.”

ほんしつ【本質】
(1)物事の本来の性質や姿。 それなしにはその物が存在し得ない性質・要素。
「問題の～を見誤る」
(2)〔哲〕
〔(ラテン) essentia; (ドイツ) Wesen〕
（ア）伝統的には， 存在者の何であるかを規定するもの。 事物にたまたま付帯する性格に対して， 事物の存在にかかわるもの。 また， 事物が現に実在するということに対して， 事物の何であるかということ。 （イ）ヘーゲルでは， 存在から概念に至る弁証法的発展の中間段階。 （ウ）現象学では， 本質直観によってとらえられる事象の形相。

essence; (real) substance; true nature; essential [intrinsic] qualities.
●人間の本質 human nature.

●日本文化の本質に触れる思いがする feel as if one were touching the essence of Japanese culture.
●問題の本質を探る probe into [explore] the essence of a problem
・物事の本質を見極める[見抜く] grasp [penetrate to] the essence [substance] of things.
本質的 ⇒ほんしつてき.
本質論
●本質論をする[展開する] discuss [talk about] the essence of 《art, benevolence, life, etc.》.

〔(ドイツ) Angst〕
人間存在の根底にある虚無からくる危機的気分。 原因や対象がわからない点で恐れと異なる。 実存主義など現代哲学の主要概念。
(3)〔心〕 漠とした恐れの感情。 動悸(ドウキ)・発汗などの身体的徴候を伴うことが多い。

ふあん【不安】
〔気がかり･心配〕 uneasiness; uncertainty; anxiety; apprehension; misgivings; unrest; restlessness; 〔どっちつかずの状態〕 suspense; 〔怖れ〕 fear.
～な uneasy; ill at ease; restless; anxious; (宙ぶらりんの) suspenseful; (恐い) fearful.
●不安な感じ a feeling of unrest [restlessness]
・不安な顔 an anxious look
・不安な顔つきをする look anxious [concerned]
・不安な気持ちで with an uneasy [a queasy] conscience
・不安な一夜を明かす pass the night in anxiety; pass an uneasy night
・不安な避難生活を送る lead an uneasy life as a refugee.
●手術には少なからぬ不安があったが, 成功した. I was quite ill at ease over the surgery, but it was successful.
・原発の安全性について住民の不安が大きい. Citizens are very ill at ease concerning the safety of the nuclear power plant.
・昨今の国際情勢を見ると新たな戦争の不安が募る. In light of the recent international situation, anxiety about a new war is intensifying.
・初めてのお産の前には妊婦は不安が高まるものだ. Pregnant women are usually anxious before giving birth for the first time.
・それで彼の深刻な不安が幾分やわらげられるかもしれない. That might alleviate his uneasiness slightly.
・幕が上がると不思議に不安が消えた[去った]. When the curtain rose, surprisingly my anxiety disappeared.
・その計画には一抹の不安が残る. I still have a tinge of uneasiness about that project.
・リストラされるかも知れないという不安が彼の心にうずまいていた. A sense of anxiety that he might be restructured out of his job swirled through his mind.
●不安でたまらない be overcome with apprehensions.
●不安に思う, 不安を感じる feel uneasy [ill at ease] 《about…》; be anxious 《about…》; be uncertain 《over…》; be in suspense
・私は首になりはしないかと不安に思っている. I'm afraid I'll lose my job [be fired].
・何も不安に思うことはないよ. 練習した通りにやればいいんだ. There's nothing to worry about. Just do like you've practiced.
・不安にさせる[陥れる] cause sb uneasiness
・不安になる lose one's peace of mind; grow restless [uneasy]
・絶えず不安におののく be [sit, stand, walk] (up) on thorns
・将来のことを考えると不安に襲われる[駆られる]. When I think about the future, I am seized by anxiety.
・不安に胸をどきどきさせて with palpitating anxiety.
●不安のまったくない above all worry
・不安の念に駆られる be pursued by uneasiness; be attacked by an indefinite inquietude
・不安の影がよぎる throw a shadow of uneasiness; cast a gloom 《on…》
・そう考えると私の心に少なからぬ不安の念が湧き起こった. The thought brought no small uneasiness to my mind.
●不安を抱く entertain some apprehensions 《about…》; be under some uneasiness 《at…》; feel [have] some misgivings 《about…》
・彼のアドバイスで私は不安を払拭することができた. Thanks to his advice I was able to rid myself of uneasiness. | His advice swept away my anxiety.
・世間の人の不安を一掃する drive away a general feeling of unrest
・心の不安を除く free the mind from anxiety
・今回の解決法は根本的なものではなく, 今後に不安を残すものとなった. This method of solution is not a fundamental one and it leaves anxiety for the future.
・最近人々の不安をかきたてるような事件が多い. Recently there have been many incidents that have made people worried.
●結果がどうなるかと絶えず不安であった. I was in constant suspense [anxiety] as to the result.
・不安なんかあるものか. Why should I be anxious?
・コンピューターのことは彼のような専門家に任せておけば少しも不安はない. If we leave the computer matters to a specialist like him there is absolutely nothing for us to worry about.
不安がる be uneasy; be anxious.
●不安がる親をよそに子供たちは冒険の旅に出発した. Leaving behind their anxious parents, the children set out on an adventurous trip.
不安げ uneasiness.
●不安げな表情で with an anxious expression
・不安げに見守る nervously watch over sth.
社会不安 social anxiety.
不安感 a sense of unease; a feeling of uneasiness; 〔特に漠とした〕 malaise.
不安材料 reasons for uneasiness.

I あんじん【安心】
〔仏〕
(1)教えを聞いたり， 修行を積むことで， 心の動くことのなくなった境地。
(2)浄土宗で， 阿弥陀仏の救いを信じて疑わず， 浄土往生を願う心をいう。

II あんしん【安心】
心が安らかに落ち着いていること。 不安や心配がないこと。 また， そのさま。
「母を～させる」「彼にまかせておけば～だ」
〔「安神」とも書く〕

あんしん【安心】
〔心配のないこと〕 peace of mind; freedom from care [anxiety]; 〔安堵〕 (a sense of) relief; 〔大丈夫･安全〕 (a sense of) security; safety; assurance; reassurance.
～する feel easy 《about…》; feel at rest [ease]; make oneself easy 《about…》; set [have] one's mind [heart] at rest [ease]; 〔ほっとする〕 feel [be] relieved; relax; 〔大丈夫[安全]だと思う〕 feel reassured; be [rest] assured; be confident 《of…》.
●安心している feel at ease; be relieved; not be worried
・安心しきっている have one's mind quite at rest; be completely reassured
・安心して 〔心配なく〕 free from fear [care, anxiety]; without anxiety; without losing one's nerve; feeling at rest; 〔ほっとして〕 with a sense of relief; (feeling) relieved; 〔大丈夫[安全]だと感じて〕 with a sense of security
・安心して死ぬ die in peace; 〔心残りなく〕 die without regrets; die at peace with oneself [the world]
・この本はだれにでも安心して勧められる. I can confidently recommend this book to anybody.
・(こう事故が頻発しては)安心してここのタクシーには乗れない. You can't trust yourself to a taxi driver here. | You (just) don't feel safe in a taxi here.
・あの人になら安心して金を預けられるよ. You can trust him with money. | He can be trusted to look after your money.
・あの人になら安心して仕事を任せられる. You can trust him to do the work. | You'd be quite safe leaving the work up to him.
・安心して子供が産める制度がほしい. If only there was a system that allowed trouble-free childbirth. | What I think we need is a system where you can have a baby without any worries.
・この肉は十分加熱すれば安心して食べられる. If thoroughly heated, this meat is perfectly safe to eat.
・十分準備していたから研究発表は安心してできた. Having done ample preparation, I was able to make a confident presentation. | I had prepared thoroughly, and so didn't lose my nerve [kept my cool] during my presentation.
・安心してご使用いただけます. Our customers are guaranteed satisfaction. | Satisfaction guaranteed.
・安心させる set sb at ease; ease sb's mind; relieve sb of his anxiety; take a load off sb's mind
・大丈夫だと安心させる assure sb that everything is [will be] all right; set sb's mind at rest by assuring him that all is OK
・早く結婚して親を安心させてくれ. Hurry up and get married, and take a load off your parents' minds!
・大いに安心したことには to one's great relief
・持ち直したって? それで安心した. He's getting better(, then)? That's a relief to know [a weight off my mind].
・全員無事だって? ああ, 安心した. Everyone's safe? Oh, I'm so relieved [that's such a relief, what a relief]!
・彼の返事を聞いて安心した. His answer reassured me. | His reply was a relief to hear.
・その知らせを聞いて大いに安心した. The news came as a great relief (to me). | I was greatly relieved at the news.
・事件が落着して一同大いに安心した. The matter has been settled, to everybody's great relief [to the great relief of all concerned].
・うまく行くだろうと思って安心している. I am sure that it will go well. | I am confident of a good result [her success].
・あまり安心はできないよ. You can't [shouldn't] be too confident. | Don't be too sure of it.
・大丈夫合格するから安心してくれ. Don't worry; I'll pass (the exam). | I'll pass! Don't worry!
・一同無事ですからご安心ください. I am glad to tell you that we are all safe. | We're all safe and sound, so please don't worry (any more).
・(病気の)峠は越えましたから安心してください. You can feel at ease [rest assured] now: the disease has passed its turning point. | The worst (of the disease) is over, so there's no need to worry (any more).
●まずは安心とひと息つく give [heave] a sigh of relief; sigh in relief; breathe (freely) again.
●金を出して安心を買う時代になった. We're living in an age in which you pay a price for security [peace of mind].
●(ガスは)元栓をしめておけば安心である. It would be safest to turn (the gas) off at the mains.
・(流感は)予防注射をしておけば安心である. You will be on the safe side if you have a shot (against the flu).
・これだけ旅費があれば安心だ. This is quite enough for my traveling expenses.
・病人はもう安心だ. The patient is out of danger. | There is no longer any need for concern about the patient.
・仕事がこの調子で進行すればもう安心だ. Now that such progress is being [has been] made on the work, we can take things easy. | With the work proceeding in this way we don't have to worry any more.
・ここまで来ればもう安心だ, 入賞圏内に入ったぞ. You've done well so far and now you can relax: you're (definitely) in the running for a prize.
・もう追っ手は来ない, 安心だ. No one's following us now. We're safe.
・人数が多ければ安心だ. There is safety in numbers.
・車は渋滞して遅れるかもしれない. 電車のほうが安心だ. If we went by car we might be held up in the traffic. The train would be safer.
安心感 a sense [feeling] of security.
●彼は安心感を持てる投手だ. You can feel safe when he's pitching. | He's a pitcher you can trust (to pitch a solid game).
・あなたのすることには安心感が抱けない. I don't feel safe with what you do [the way you do things]. | The things you do don't inspire me with confidence.
安心料 the price (paid) for security [peace of mind].
●A 校に入学金を納めたのは B 校入試の結果が出るまでの安心料だ. Paying the registration fees for college A was the price I paid for peace of mind while waiting for the results from college B.

I ほんと【本当】
「ほんとう（本当）」の転。 会話語として使われる。
「え， ～か」「～の話はこうなんだ」

II ほんとう【本当】
(1)まちがっていたり， うそであったりしない・こと（さま）。 真実。 事実。 本物。 ほんと。
⇔ うそ
「～のことを言う」「その話は～だ」「～を言うと， 私は行きたくない」「それは～なのか」「～の友達」
(2)本来そうあるべきであること。 当然なすべきこと。
「体が～ではない」「～はこちらがあやまらなければならない」「代理でなくて本人が来るのが～だ」

ほんとう【本当】
1 〔真実･事実･実際〕
●本当は in (point of) fact; actually; in reality [actuality]; really; as a matter of fact; the truth (of the matter) is 《that…》
・それが本当でもうそでも whether that's the truth or a lie [true or false].
●本当に 〔嘘ではなく〕 truly; really; actually; for real; 〔本気で〕 in (real) earnest [⇒本当に]
・君は本当にそう思ってるのか. Do you really think that (way)?
・本当にする believe; take sth seriously; accept sth as true
・人の言うことを本当にする take sb at his word
・だれがそんな話を本当にするものか. Who would believe a story like that? | Tell that to the marines!
・本当にそうなのか(＝本気か). Do you really mean what you say?
・これは去年本当にあったことなんだ. This (is something that) really happened last year.
●本当の 〔真の〕 true; real; actual; 〔事実上の〕 veritable; 〔実在する〕 substantial
・本当のこと the truth; a fact; a reality
・本当のことを言えば to speak the truth; truth to tell; to tell you the truth; in reality
・では本当のことを言います. Okay, I'll tell you the truth.
・本当のところはどうなんだ? Now tell me what really happened.
・本当の私[自分]を探す search for the real me
・本当の友だち a true friend
・本当の兄弟 one's real [true] brother; full brothers
・本当の悪人 a real rascal
・本当の意味での幸福 happiness in the true sense of the word
・その語の本当の意味において in the true [truest, real] meaning of the word [term]
・本当の年を教えてください. Tell me your real age [how old you really are].
・彼は決して本当の気持ちを明かさない. He never lays bare [gives away] his real [true] feelings.
・この地方の本当の寒さはこんなものじゃない. This is nothing like how cold it really gets in these parts.
・あれこそ本当の芸人だ. Now that's what I call a real entertainer!
●本当だね. 〔同意して〕 I agree with you. | 〔念を押して〕 You're not kidding me now, are you?
・それって本当? Can it be true? | Is that really true?
・〔驚いて〕 本当ですか. Really? | Really and truly? | 〔まさか!〕 You don't say! | You're kidding.
・本当かどうかわからないことを人に言うものではない. Never say anything that you don't know to be true [for certain].
・彼の言っていることは本当らしい. He seems to be telling the truth.
・本当言うと私は彼が好きじゃないんだ. To tell the truth, I don't like him.
・本当は彼は解雇されたのだ. The truth is, he was fired.
・「急がば回れ」とは本当だ. “Make haste slowly”―truer words were never spoken.
・大丈夫, それは本当だよ. Take it from me [Take my word for it], it's true.
・彼女離婚だって, 本当だよ. You know the rumor that she's getting divorced? Well, it's true.
・私はそんなことはしていません, 本当です. I didn't do it; on my word of honor.
・彼女にちょっと仕事を教えてもらってただけなんだ. 本当だってば. She was only explaining to me what I have to do in my job, that's all. Honestly.
2 〔本来･本筋〕
●本当の 〔正しい〕 proper; right
・それが本当のやり方だ. That's the proper [right] way to go about it.
●本当を言えば properly speaking; to speak properly
・本当を言えばこれは論理学の題目だ. Properly speaking, this subject belongs to logic.
●…と呼ぶのが本当だろう. It would be proper to call it….

Iたぶん【多分】

～の much; a great deal [lot] of…; many a; a great many; considerable; generous [liberal]; large.

・多分の心付け a large [generous] tip
・多分の寄付 a large [generous, liberal] donation.
多分に much; in large [great] measure; greatly; in large part.
●多分に頂戴する 〔酒など〕 have in large quantity; have enough; 〔報酬などを〕 receive a liberal amount of 《gratuity, reward》
・彼女は詩人の素質を多分に備えている. She has very much the makings of a poet in her.
・彼にはわがままなところが多分にある. He has a large measure of selfishness in him.

・彼女の抜擢はその人柄が多分に関係している. Her being singled out for promotion has very much to do with her personality.
IIたぶん【多分】
〔おそらく〕 probably; likely; 《口》 (as) like as not; 〔十中八九まで〕 in nine cases out of ten; ten to one. <▲> maybe, perhaps は「たぶん」より可能性が低く「もしかしたら…, …かもしれない」に近い.
●たぶん…だろう it is probable [likely] that…; the probability is that…; the chances [odds] are that….
●たぶん彼は 22 歳ぐらいだ. I'd say he's probably about twenty-two.
・あの人はたぶんロシア人でしょう. That person's probably a Russian.
・たぶん(君の所へは)行けないだろう. I probably won't be able to go (to your place).
・たぶん忘れたのだろう. He's probably [He's likely to have] forgotten. | It's likely he's forgotten. | 《口》 Likely he's forgotten.
・たぶん内閣は半年もたないでしょう. Probably [I'll bet you] the Cabinet won't last (even) half a year.
・彼が言うことはたぶん本当だろう. What he says is probably true.
・たぶんそうでしょう. You're [That's] probably right.
・たぶんそうなんだろうね. 〔確信はないがまわりはそう思っているらしい〕 I suppose so. | It seems likely.
・「彼女も来るかな」「たぶんね」 “I wonder if she's coming, too.”―“Probably.”

●名前だけは立派なホテル a grand hotel in name only
・社長といっても名前だけだ. He is president in name only. | He is a figurehead president.
・名前だけは知っているが大して付き合いはない. I know the name but have no real contact with him.
・その場所なら名前だけは知っている. I know the place in name only.

・その名前すら知らない. I have never even heard the name.

・その著者もどうにか名前が知られるようになった. That author has somehow managed to become well known [popular].
・名前がないと呼ぶときに困るから何か考えなくちゃ. We can't call 《the cat》 without a name, so think of something.
・顔には見覚えがあるのだが, 彼の名前が出てこない. I recognize his face, but can't remember his name.
・革命後に都市の名前が変更された. The name of the city was changed after the revolution.
・彼の名前が名簿から落ちて[漏れて]いる. His name has been removed [omitted] from the directory.

●名前の由来 the origin of a name

・名前を告げる give one's name
・名前を…だと言う give one's name as…
・名前を明かす disclose one's name
・名前を呼ぶ call sb by name
・あの男の名前を知らないなんてもぐりだね. Anyone who doesn't know that fellow's name must be a fraud.
・名前を覚える remember sb's name
・名前を偽る lie about one's name; give a false name
・名前を貸す lend one's name 《to a project》
・名前を伏せて ⇒匿名を条件に ⇒とくめい1
・私は彼の名前を尋ねた. I asked him (for) his name.
・僕は人の名前をよく忘れる. I have a bad [poor] memory for names.
・ベテランのホテルマンは得意客の名前を聞いただけで部屋の好みや細かい癖まで瞬時に思い出すそうだ. Veteran hotel staff can instantly remember a regular guest's room preference and habits just from the mention of their name.
●お名前は. May I ask [have] your name? | What is your name, please? | 〔取り次ぐとき〕 What name shall I say?
・失礼ですが何というお名前でしたっけ? I'm sorry, but could I please have your name again?
・とても一度に皆さんのお名前は覚え切れません. I cannot remember everyone's names at once.
・お名前は一々挙げないが, ご協力くださった方々にここに感謝の意を申し述べたい. Although I cannot mention everyone by name, I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the people who assisted me 《in my research》.

おおげさ【大袈裟】
～な 〔実際より誇張した〕 exaggerated; overblown; (言葉などが) pretentious; bombastic; overblown; 《口》 highfalutin(g); 〔必要以上に大掛かりな〕 overdone.
●大げさな話 an exaggeration; a hyperbole; an overstatement; a tall story; a story about the one that got away
・ささいな出来事が大げさな話になって世間に伝わった. A trivial event was blown out of all proportions and made public knowledge.
・大げさな言葉 bombast; hyperbole; inflated [bombastic, overblown] language; pretentious verbiage
・今日の彼の演説はやたら大げさな言葉が多くて何を言っているのかよくわからなかった. He used so much inflated language in his speech today I couldn't figure out what he was saying.
・大げさな身ぶりで with exaggerated gestures
・大げさな感情表現はかえって読む者をしらけさせるものだ. Exaggerated expressions of emotion tend, instead, to kill the reader's interest [turn the reader off].
・翌日彼は大げさな包帯姿で出社してきた. The next day he showed up at the company with this great big bandage.
・1 泊の旅行にしてはずいぶん大げさな荷物だね. For a one-night [an overnight] trip you're taking an awful lot of luggage.
・試験というほど大げさなものではありませんが, ちょっとした面接を受けてください. It's not an examination or any big deal like that, but we'd like you to have a simple interview.
・受験に失敗したくらいで大げさなことを言うな. Okay, so you didn't pass an entrance exam; you don't have to make such a big thing of it.
●彼はいつも話が大げさだから割り引いて聞かないといけないよ. Because he always exaggerates [hyperbolizes, draws a long bow], you have to take what he says with a grain of salt.
・大げさかもしれないが, その時は本当に死ぬかと思ったんだよ. This may sound like an exaggeration, but at the time I really thought I would die.
・彼にとって妻は彼の命そのものだったと言っても決して大げさではない. It is no exaggeration to say that, as far as he was concerned, his wife was life itself to him.
・泣くなよ, 大げさだなあ. 1 週間で帰るってば. Stop crying. You're overreacting; I'll only be (away for) a week.
・たかが盲腸の手術におふくろは大げさすぎるよ. It's only an appendectomy, Mom; you're making too big a thing out of this.
大袈裟に exaggeratedly; with exaggeration; in an exaggerated [overdone, overstated] way.
●…を大げさに言う exaggerate; overdo; overstate; hyperbolize; draw a [the] long bow; make a big thing of…
・あの人は事を大げさに言う癖がある. He has a habit of exaggerating things.
・大げさに言えば to exaggerate [hyperbolize]
・少し大げさに言えば if I may be allowed a little exaggeration [hyperbole]
・大げさに言うとそれは命を懸けた初恋だった. I know this is an exaggeration, but it was a first love that I threw myself into completely―body and soul.
・大げさに書き立てる play up 《an affair》; give an overblown [exaggerated] description 《of…》
・彼女のスピード違反は紙上で大げさに書き立てられた. Her speeding violation was played up in the newspapers.
・被告は判事に犯行時の自分の窮状を大げさに訴えた. The defendant [accused] presented the judge with an exaggerated account of his hardship [straitened circumstances] at the time of the offense.
・僕は彼女の気を引こうとして大げさに痛がってみせた. In order to attract her attention I made an exaggerated display of pain.
・私がちょっとせきでもしようものなら, 心配性の祖母は薬だ医者だと大げさに騒ぎ立てる. All I have to do is cough a bit and my worrywart grandmother, blowing it all out of proportion, begins talking about taking medicine and seeing a doctor.
・君らは物事を大げさに考えすぎるんだよ. You people make mountains out of molehills.
・彼が気軽に言ったことを君は大げさに考えすぎてるよ. You are reading too much into what he intended as a lighthearted remark.

I-がい【-外】

1 〔他所〕 some other place.

●…のほかに[は] 〔…を除いては〕 except…; excepting…; but…; save…; with the exception of…; barring…; outside of…; 〔その上に〕 besides…; in addition 《to…》; on top of 《it》
・このほかに besides; in addition to this

・ほかにすべきことがある have something else to do

・ほかに何も言わずに別れた. We parted without saying anything else.

・ほかに説明のしようがない. I can't explain it in any other way.

・ほかに用事がなければ一緒に来ませんか. Please come with me, if you are not otherwise engaged.
●ほかの other; another; different; else
・ほかの本 another book; other books
・(何か)ほかのもの[こと] something else
・(だれか)ほかの人[者] someone else
・ほかの人たち other people; others
・ほかの人ならいざ知らず, あの人がそんなことをするとは考えられない. He is the last person I would suspect of doing a thing like that.

●風邪を引いているほかは悪いところはない. I am well, except [apart from the fact] that I have a cold.

4 〔ある範囲のそと〕 outside [beyond] a certain limit.
●思いのほか beyond one's imagination

II つち【土・地】

まっさき【真っ先】
〔「まさき（真先）」の転〕
一番はじめ。 最初。 先頭。
「～に仕上げる」「～に駆けつける」

まっさき【真っ先】
〔先頭〕 the head; 〔いちばん初め〕 the beginning.
●真っ先に 〔最初に〕 at the very first [beginning]; 〔何より前に〕 first of all; before anything else
・真っ先に敵陣に突っ込む go first into the fray
・教師が質問すると, いつも彼女が真っ先に手をあげる. Whenever the teacher asked a question, she was the first to raise her hand.
・宿泊先に着いたら真っ先にシャワーを浴びた. The first thing I did when I reached the place where I was staying was to have a shower.
・退院したら真っ先に何食べたい? What's the first thing you want to eat when you get out of (《米》 the) hospital?
・真っ先に彼が駆けつけた. He was the first to arrive on the scene.
・偉そうなことを言ってたくせに真っ先に逃げだした. Despite all the high-sounding things he said, he was the first to run away.
・朝起きると真っ先に家中の窓を開ける. As soon as I get up [First thing in the morning] I open all the windows in the house.
・真っ先に起きるのは決まって母だ. My mother is always the first (to get) up.
・故障の原因として真っ先に考えられるのは断線だ. The first thing that comes to mind as the cause of the accident is a snapped wire.
●真っ先の the first.

I なことば【名詞】
⇒ めいし（名詞）

II めいし【名詞】
品詞の一。 事物の名を表し， またそれを指し示す自立語。 活用がなく， 単独で主語となり得るもの。 また， 「の」「を」「に」などの助詞を伴って連体修飾語・連用修飾語となり， 「だ」などを伴って述語にもなる。 その下位区分に普通名詞・固有名詞・数詞などの類がある。 代名詞とともに体言と総称される。
〔代名詞をも名詞に含める説もあり， この説では， 名詞すなわち体言ということになる〕

めいし【名詞】
【文法】 a noun; a (noun) substantive.

名詞失語症 【医】 nominal aphasia.

かせい【火星】
〔Mars〕
太陽系の第四惑星。 地球の軌道のすぐ外側に軌道をもつ。 赤く見えるので， 西洋では軍神マルスにたとえられ， 日本では「災星(ワザワイボシ)」「炎星(ホノオボシ)」などといわれる。 中国名は熒惑(ケイコク)。 公転周期1.88年。 自転周期は約二四時間三七分。 赤道半径3397キロメートル。 質量は地球の〇・一〇七倍。 二つの衛星をもつ。 冬になると大きくなる極冠が知られている。 また， クレーターや， 過去に水の浸食を受けたように見える大峡谷なども発見された。

3 〔外部･よそ〕 another place; somewhere else.

IIIほか【外･他】
1 〔他所〕 some other place.

2 〔外部〕 outside.

3 〔それ以外･別〕

●川崎氏ほか3 名 Mr. Kawasaki and three others; four people including Mr. Kawasaki.
●…のほかに[は] 〔…を除いては〕 except…; excepting…; but…; save…; with the exception of…; barring…; outside of…; 〔その上に〕 besides…; in addition 《to…》; on top of 《it》
・このほかに besides; in addition to this
・そうするよりほかに仕方がない. There is no other way [nothing for it] but to do so. | That is the only thing we can do [course open to us]. | There is [We have] no choice [alternative] but to do so.
・君のほかに頼る人はいない. I have no one but you to turn to for help.
・月給のほかに少し収入がある. He has something besides his salary.
・決められた料金のほかにチップとして 1,000 円渡した. I tipped him \1,000 over and above the regular charge.
・釣りのほかに道楽はない. I have no hobby except fishing.
・彼はちょっと遅刻が多いがほかに欠点はない. Apart from [Except for] frequently arriving late, he has no faults.
・あんなことができるのは彼女をおいてほかにいない. She is the only person who can do that.
・彼をおいてほかに適当な人はない. He is just the man for it.

・ほかにすべきことがある have something else to do

・ほかに何かやることはありませんか. Is there anything else I can do?
・ほかに何も言わずに別れた. We parted without saying anything else.

・ほかに説明のしようがない. I can't explain it in any other way.

・ほかに用事がなければ一緒に来ませんか. Please come with me, if you are not otherwise engaged.
●ほかの other; another; different; else
・ほかの本 another book; other books
・(何か)ほかのもの[こと] something else
・(だれか)ほかの人[者] someone else
・ほかの人たち other people; others

4 〔ある範囲のそと〕 outside [beyond] a certain limit.

じゅうだい【重大】
～な important; weighty; serious; grave; momentous; material; 《a matter》 of great [vital] importance [《文》 import, moment]; 《文》 of much consequence.
●重大な問題 an important [a serious, a vital, a grave] problem [question, issue] [⇒じゅうだいもんだい]
・われわれにはきわめて重大な問題だ. It is a matter of vital importance [of the utmost concern] to us.
・この事件は重大な問題をはらんでいる. This affair is fraught with serious questions [issues].
・重大な責任 weighty [serious] responsibility
・重大な結果 a grave consequence

・…に重大な影響を持つ have an important influence upon 《the education of children》
・この程度なら計画に重大な影響はないだろう. If that's all it is, it shouldn't have much impact on the project.
・重大な見落とし a serious oversight
・きわめて重大な事柄 a matter of the utmost magnitude
・重大な過失 gross negligence
・重大な犯罪 a serious [《文》 heinous] crime
・重大な痛手 a fatal blow
・重大な時期に at a critical moment
・重大な局面に差しかかる reach [come to] a critical phase
・重大な危険をはらんでいる be fraught with the gravest danger
・重大な役割を演じる play an important role
・重大な関係 a critical [critically important] relationship
・この事業は国の利害に重大な関係を持つ. This project bears critically on the national interest.
・この病気は脂肪の取り過ぎと重大な関係がある. The disease is critically tied to the overconsumption of fats.
・重大な支障を来たす pose [constitute] a grave obstacle 《to progress》
・重大かつ回復不能な障害 a substantial [grave] and irreparable injury
・…にとって重大である[ない] signify a great deal [little, nothing] to sb
・…ほど重大でない be of less importance than…
・重大でなくなる lose 《its》 importance; recede into the background
・あまり重大でない問題 a question of little gravity
・彼は重大な使命を帯びている. He is charged with an important mission.
・天候はこの計画の成否を決する重大な要素だ. The weather will figure large in (the success or failure of) our plan.
●事は重大だ. This is serious [not something to be taken lightly].
・君の責任は重大だ. You bear a lot of the blame [responsibility] (for this).
重大さ importance; seriousness; gravity; weight; magnitude.
●事の重大さを痛感する be painfully aware of the gravity of the matter
・事の重大さに鑑み in view of the gravity [importance] of the matter
・上司はこの問題の重大さがわかっていない. My boss doesn't grasp the magnitude of the problem.
・私はその時初めて自分のしたことの重大さを理解した. It was then that I first came to realize the gravity of what I had done.
・罪の重大さを考えると, この判決はずいぶん甘い. Given the seriousness of the crime, this verdict is far too lenient.
重大に
●今回の事件をわれわれ首脳部は重大に受け止めております. Those of us in authority are taking this incident most seriously.
重大になる become critical [serious] (in character); assume serious [grave] proportions; 〔悪化する〕 become very bad; be exacerbated; worsen. [⇒じゅうだいか]
●事が重大になってきた. The matter has assumed serious proportions.
・事態はますます重大になってきた. The situation has gotten even worse.
・このような状況では各人の冷静な判断が重大になってくる. Under these circumstances it becomes essential that each of us maintain a cool sense of judgment.
重大関心事 a matter of the utmost [gravest] concern.
重大視 ⇒じゅうだいし.
重大事(件) a serious affair [incident, case]; an important [a grave] matter; a momentous event.
重大事故 a serious [fatal, grave, major] accident.
重大性 ＝重大さ.
●時局の重大性 the gravity of the situation.

●重大声明を発表する issue [put out] an important statement [announcement].

ひ【火】
